Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-204(4)(b): include in written notices of franchisor's recalls to new powersport vehicle owners and franchisees the expected date by which necessary parts and equipment will be available to franchisees for the correction of the defects; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-204(4)(c): compensate any of the franchisees for repairs effected by the recall.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-204(5): If a franchisor disallows a franchisee's claim for a defective part, alleging that the part is not defective, the franchisor at its option shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-204(5)(a): return the part to the franchisee at the franchisor's expense; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-204(5)(b): pay the franchisee the cost of the part.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-204(6): 
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-204(6)(a): A claim made by a franchisee pursuant to this section for labor and parts shall be paid within 30 days after its approval.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-204(6)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-204(6)(b)(i): A claim shall be either approved or disapproved by the franchisor within 30 days after receipt of the claim on a form generally used by the franchisor and containing the generally required information.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-204(6)(b)(ii): Any claim not specifically disapproved of in writing within 30 days after the receipt of the form is considered to be approved, and payment shall be made within 30 days.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-204(7): Warranty service audits of franchisee records may be conducted by the franchisor on a reasonable basis.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-204(8): A franchisee's claim for warranty compensation may not be denied except for good cause such as performance of nonwarranty repairs, lack of material documentation, fraud, or misrepresentation.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-204(9): (9)(c); (9)

Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-205 Liability for damages to motor vehicles in transit -- Disclosure required.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-205(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-205(1)(a): A franchisee is solely liable for damage to a new powersport vehicle after delivery by and acceptance from the carrier.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-205(1)(b): A delivery receipt or bill of lading, or similar document, signed by a franchisee is evidence of a franchisee's acceptance of a new powersport vehicle.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-205(2): A franchisor is liable for all damage to a powersport vehicle before delivery to and acceptance by the franchisee, including that time in which the vehicle is in the control of a carrier or transporter.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-205(3): A franchisor shall disclose to the franchisee any repairs made prior to delivery, only if the cost of the repair exceeds 3% of the manufacturer's wholesale price, as measured by retail repair costs.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-205(4): (1); (2); (3) Notwithstanding Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-205(4)(a): the method and mode of transportation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-205(4)(b): the carrier or transporter.

Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-302(2)(b)(i): of the same line-make as the franchisee's dealership; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-302(2)(b)(ii): in the franchisee's existing dealership's relevant market area.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-302(3): (3)(c)(ii) For purposes of this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-302(3)(a): relocation of an existing franchisee's dealership in excess of one mile from its existing location is considered the establishment of an additional franchise in the line-make of the relocating franchise;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-302(3)(b): the reopening in a relevant market area of a dealership that has not been in operation for one year or more is considered the establishment of an additional powersport vehicle dealership; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-302(3)(c): (3)(c)(ii)
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-302(3)(c)(i): (3)(c)(ii) except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-302(3)(c)(ii): the establishment of a temporary additional place of business by a powersport vehicle franchisee is not considered the establishment of an additional powersport vehicle dealership if the powersport vehicle franchisee is participating in a trade show where three or more powersport vehicle dealers are participating.


Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-302 Issuance of additional franchises -- Relocation of existing franchisees.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-302(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-302(1)(a): Except as provided in Subsection (2), a franchisor shall comply with Subsection (1)(b) if the franchisor seeks to:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-302(1)(a)(i): enter into a franchise establishing a powersport vehicle dealership within a relevant market area where the same line-make is represented by another franchisee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-302(1)(a)(ii): relocate an existing powersport vehicle dealership.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-302(1)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-302(1)(b)(i): If a franchisor seeks to take an action listed in Subsection (1)(a), prior to taking the action, the franchisor shall in writing notify the executive director and each franchisee in that line-make in the relevant market area that the franchisor intends to take an action described in Subsection (1)(a).
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-302(1)(b)(ii): The notice required by Subsection (1)(b)(i) shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-302(1)(b)(ii)(A): specify the good cause on which it intends to rely for the action; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-302(1)(b)(ii)(B): be delivered by registered or certified mail or by any form of reliable delivery through which receipt is verifiable.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-302(1)(c): Within 45 days of receiving notice required by Subsection (1)(b), any franchisee that is required to receive notice under Subsection (1)(b) may protest to the executive director the establishing or relocating of the dealership.  When a protest is filed, the department shall inform the franchisor that:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-302(1)(c)(i): a timely protest has been filed;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-302(1)(c)(ii): a hearing is required;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-302(1)(c)(iii): the franchisor may not establish or relocate the proposed dealership until the executive director has held a hearing; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-302(1)(c)(iv): the franchisor may not establish or relocate a proposed dealership if the executive director determines that there is not good cause for permitting the establishment or relocation of the dealership.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-302(1)(d): If multiple protests are filed under Subsection (1)(c), hearings may be consolidated to expedite the disposition of the issue.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-302(2): Subsection (1) does not apply to  the relocation of a franchisee's dealership:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-302(2)(a): less than two miles from the existing location of the franchisee's dealership; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-302(2)(b): farther away from all powersport dealerships that are:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-302(2)(b)(i): of the same line-make as the franchisee's dealership; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-302(2)(b)(ii): in the franchisee's existing dealership's relevant market area.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-302(3): For purposes of this section:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-302(3)(a): relocation of an existing franchisee's dealership in excess of one mile from its existing location is considered the establishment of an additional franchise in the line-make of the relocating franchise;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-302(3)(b): the reopening in a relevant market area of a dealership that has not been in operation for one year or more is considered the establishment of an additional powersport vehicle dealership; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-302(3)(c): 
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-302(3)(c)(i): except as provided in Subsection (3)(c)(ii), the establishment of a temporary additional place of business by a powersport vehicle franchisee is considered the establishment of an additional powersport vehicle dealership; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-302(3)(c)(ii): the establishment of a temporary additional place of business by a powersport vehicle franchisee is not considered the establishment of an additional powersport vehicle dealership if the powersport vehicle franchisee is participating in a trade show where three or more powersport vehicle dealers are participating.

Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-305 Evidence to be considered in determining cause to terminate or discontinue.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-305(1): In determining whether a franchisor has established good cause for terminating or not continuing a franchise agreement, the advisory board and the executive director shall consider:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-305(1)(a): the amount of business transacted by the franchisee, as compared to business available to the franchisee;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-305(1)(b): the investment necessarily made and obligations incurred by the franchisee in the performance of the franchisee's part of the franchise agreement;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-305(1)(c): the permanency of the investment;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-305(1)(d): whether it is injurious or beneficial to the public welfare or public interest for the business of the franchisee to be disrupted;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-305(1)(e): whether the franchisee has adequate powersport vehicle sales and service facilities, equipment, vehicle parts, and qualified service personnel to reasonably provide for the needs of the consumer for the new powersport vehicles handled by the franchisee and has been and is rendering adequate services to the public;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-305(1)(f): whether the franchisee refuses to honor warranties of the franchisor under which the warranty service work is to be performed pursuant to the franchise agreement, if the franchisor reimburses the franchisee for the warranty service work;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-305(1)(g): failure by the franchisee to substantially comply with those requirements of the franchise agreement that are determined by the advisory board or the executive director to be:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-305(1)(g)(i): reasonable;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-305(1)(g)(ii): material; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-305(1)(g)(iii): not in violation of this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-305(1)(h): evidence of bad faith by the franchisee in complying with those terms of the franchise agreement that are determined by the advisory board or the executive director to be:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-305(1)(h)(i): reasonable;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-305(1)(h)(ii): material; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-305(1)(h)(iii): not in violation of this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-305(1)(i): prior misrepresentation by the franchisee in applying for the franchise;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-305(1)(j): transfer of any ownership or interest in the franchise without first obtaining approval from the franchisor or the executive director after receipt of the advisory board's recommendation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-305(1)(k): any other factor the advisory board or the executive director consider relevant.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-305(2): 13-35-201 Notwithstanding any franchise agreement, the following do not constitute good cause, as used in this chapter for the termination or noncontinuation of a franchise:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-305(2)(a): the sole fact that the franchisor desires:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-305(2)(a)(i): greater market penetration; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-305(2)(a)(ii): more sales or leases of new powersport vehicles;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-305(2)(b): the change of ownership of the franchisee's dealership or the change of executive management of the franchisee's dealership unless the franchisor proves that the change of ownership or executive management will be substantially detrimental to the distribution of the franchisor's powersport vehicles; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-305(2)(c): 13-35-201 the fact that the franchisee has justifiably refused or declined to participate in any conduct covered by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-305(3): (2) For purposes of Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-306 Evidence to be considered in determining cause to relocate existing franchisee or establish a new franchised dealership.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
In determining whether a franchisor has established good cause for relocating an existing franchisee or establishing a new franchised dealership for the same line-make in a given relevant market area, the advisory board and the executive director shall consider:Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-306(1): the amount of business transacted by other franchisees of the same line-make in that relevant market area, as compared to business available to the franchisees;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-306(2): the investment necessarily made and obligations incurred by other franchisees of the same line-make in that relevant market area in the performance of their part of their franchisee agreements;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-306(3): the permanency of the existing and proposed investment;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-306(4): whether it is injurious or beneficial to the public welfare or public interest for an additional franchise to be established; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-306(5): whether the franchisees of the same line-make in that relevant market area are providing adequate service to consumers for the powersport vehicles of the line-make, which shall include the adequacy of:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-306(5)(a): the powersport vehicle sale and service facilities;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-306(5)(b): equipment;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-306(5)(c): supply of vehicle parts; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-35-306(5)(d): qualified service personnel.

Utah Code Annotated - Title 13 - Chapter 37 - Notice of Intent to Sell Nonpublic Personal Information Act
*********************************************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-101 Title.
--------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Notice of Intent to Sell Nonpublic Personal Information Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-102 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-102(1): "Affiliate" means a person that controls, is controlled by, or is under common control with:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-102(1)(a): a commercial entity; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-102(1)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-102(1)(b)(i): directly; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-102(1)(b)(ii): indirectly through one or more intermediaries.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-102(2): (2)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-102(2)(a): (2)(b) Subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-102(2)(a)(i): has an office or other place of business located in the state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-102(2)(a)(ii): in the ordinary course of business transacts a consumer transaction in this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-102(2)(b): "Commercial entity" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-102(2)(b)(i): a governmental entity; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-102(2)(b)(ii): an entity providing services on behalf of a governmental entity.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-102(3): "Compensation" means anything of economic value that is paid or transferred to a commercial entity for or in direct consideration of the disclosure of nonpublic personal information.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-102(4): (4)(a); 13-11-3
Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-102(4)(a): "Consumer transaction" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-102(4)(a)(i): a sale, lease, assignment, award by chance, or other written or oral transfer or disposition:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-102(4)(a)(i)(A): that is initiated or completed in this state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-102(4)(a)(i)(B): of:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-102(4)(a)(i)(B)(I): goods;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-102(4)(a)(i)(B)(II): services; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-102(4)(a)(i)(B)(III): other tangible or intangible property, except securities and insurance or services related thereto; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-102(4)(a)(ii): a transaction:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-102(4)(a)(ii)(A): that is initiated or completed in this state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-102(4)(a)(ii)(B): that constitutes credit offered or extended by a commercial entity to a person primarily for personal, family, or household purposes.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-102(4)(b): (4)(a); 13-11-3 "Consumer transaction" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-102(4)(b)(i): the use of nonpublic personal information in relation to a transaction with a person if the transaction is for primarily personal, family, or household purposes; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-102(4)(b)(ii): (4)(a); 13-11-3 with respect to any transaction described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-102(4)(b)(ii)(A): an offer or solicitation;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-102(4)(b)(ii)(B): an agreement;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-102(4)(b)(ii)(C): the performance of an agreement; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-102(4)(b)(ii)(D): 13-11-3 a charitable solicitation as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-102(4)(c): "Consumer transaction" does not include a transaction related to real property.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-102(5): 
Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-102(5)(a): "Nonpublic personal information" means information that:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-102(5)(a)(i): is not public information; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-102(5)(a)(ii): either alone or in conjunction with public information, identifies a person in distinction from other persons.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-102(5)(b): "Nonpublic personal information" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-102(5)(b)(i): a person's Social Security number;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-102(5)(b)(ii): information used to determine a person's credit worthiness including a person's:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-102(5)(b)(ii)(A): income; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-102(5)(b)(ii)(B): employment history;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-102(5)(b)(iii): the purchasing patterns of a person; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-102(5)(b)(iv): the personal preferences of a person.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-102(6): "Public information" means a person's:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-102(6)(a): name;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-102(6)(b): telephone number; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-102(6)(c): street address.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-102(7): (7)(b)
Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-102(7)(a): (7)(b) Subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-102(7)(b): "Third party" does not include an affiliate or agent of the commercial entity that obtains nonpublic personal information.

Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-201(1): (1)(a); (1)(a)(iii)(B); (5)
Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-201(1)(a): (1)(a); (1)(a)(iii)(B); (5) In accordance with this section, a commercial entity shall provide the notice described in this section to a person if:

Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-201(1)(a)(iv)(C): (5) is not compensation received by the commercial entity in consideration of a transaction described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-201(1)(b): For purposes of this chapter, a commercial entity is considered to have obtained information as a result of a consumer transaction if:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-201(1)(b)(i): the person provides the information to the commercial entity:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-201(1)(b)(i)(A): at any time during the consumer transaction; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-201(1)(b)(i)(B): at the request of the commercial entity; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-201(1)(b)(ii):

Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-201(1)(b)(ii)(B): but for the consumer transaction, the commercial entity would not obtain the information.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-201(2): (1); (1)(a) The notice required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-201(2)(a): the point at which the person is requested to provide the nonpublic personal information; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-201(2)(b): (1)(a) the commercial entity otherwise obtains the nonpublic personal information as a result of the consumer transaction described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-201(3): (1) The notice required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-201(3)(a): shall read substantially as follows:  "We may choose to disclose nonpublic personal information about you, the consumer, to a third party for compensation.";
Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-201(3)(b): may be made:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-201(3)(b)(i): orally, if the consumer transaction itself is entirely conducted orally; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-201(3)(b)(ii): in writing, if the notice is written in dark bold; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-201(3)(c): shall be sufficiently conspicuous so that a reasonable person would perceive the notice before providing the nonpublic personal information.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-37-201(4): This chapter does not apply to:

Utah Code Annotated - Title 13 - Chapter 38a - Financial Transaction Card Protection Act
****************************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 13-38a-101 Title.
---------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-38a-101(1): This chapter is known as the "Financial Transaction Card Protection Act."
Utah Code Annotated § 13-38a-101(2): This part is known as "General Provisions."


Utah Code Annotated § 13-38a-102 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 13-38a-102(1): 7-16a-102
Utah Code Annotated § 13-38a-102(1)(a): "Financial transaction card" means any card, code, or other means of access to a person's account issued to a person that allows the person to obtain, purchase, or receive any of the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-38a-102(1)(a)(i): goods;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-38a-102(1)(a)(ii): services;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-38a-102(1)(a)(iii): money; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-38a-102(1)(a)(iv): anything else of value.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-38a-102(1)(b): 7-16a-102 "Financial transaction card" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-38a-102(1)(b)(i): a credit card;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-38a-102(1)(b)(ii): a credit plate;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-38a-102(1)(b)(iii): a bank services card;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-38a-102(1)(b)(iv): a banking card;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-38a-102(1)(b)(v): a check guarantee card;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-38a-102(1)(b)(vi): a debit card;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-38a-102(1)(b)(vii): a telephone credit card; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-38a-102(1)(b)(viii): 7-16a-102 a device for access as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 13-38a-102(2): "Receipt" means any document related to the transaction of business provided to a person that uses a financial transaction card.


Utah Code Annotated § 13-38a-201 Title.
---------------------------------------
This part is known as "Financial Transaction Card Receipts."

Utah Code Annotated § 13-38a-202 Limitation on information contained in receipts.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-38a-202(1): A person that accepts a financial transaction card for the transaction of business may not, on a financial transaction card receipt:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-38a-202(1)(a): print more than the last five digits of the financial transaction card account number; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-38a-202(1)(b): print the financial transaction card expiration date.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-38a-202(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 13-38a-202(2)(a): This section applies only to receipts that are electronically printed.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-38a-202(2)(b): This section does not apply to transactions in which the initial means of recording the financial transaction card number is by:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-38a-202(2)(b)(i): handwriting; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-38a-202(2)(b)(ii): an imprint or copy of the financial transaction card.


Utah Code Annotated § 13-38a-203 Private action.
------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-38a-203(1): A person may bring an action in any state court of competent jurisdiction against a person that violates any of the requirements of this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-38a-203(2): (1) In an action under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 13-38a-203(2)(a): recover the amount of any actual damages caused by the violation of this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-38a-203(2)(b): recover court costs and reasonable attorney fees as determined by the court; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-38a-203(2)(c): seek to enjoin conduct in violation of this chapter.

Utah Code Annotated - Title 13 - Chapter 40 - Utah E-Commerce Integrity Act
***************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-101 Title.
--------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Utah E-Commerce Integrity Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-102 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-102(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-102(1)(a): "Cause to be copied" means to distribute or transfer computer software, or any component of computer software.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-102(1)(b): "Cause to be copied" does not include providing:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-102(1)(b)(i): transmission, routing, intermediate temporary storage, or caching of software;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-102(1)(b)(ii): a storage or hosting medium, such as a compact disk, website, or computer server through which the software was distributed by a third party; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-102(1)(b)(iii): an information location tool, such as a directory, index, reference, pointer, or hypertext link, through which the user of the computer located the software.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-102(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-102(2)(a): "Computer software" means a sequence of instructions written in any programming language that is executed on a computer.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-102(2)(b): "Computer software" does not include a data component of a webpage that is not executable independently of the webpage.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-102(3): "Computer virus" means a computer program or other set of instructions that is designed to degrade the performance of or disable a computer or computer network and is designed to have the ability to replicate itself on another computer or computer network without the authorization of the owner of the other computer or computer network.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-102(4): "Damage" means any significant impairment to the:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-102(4)(a): performance of a computer; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-102(4)(b): integrity or availability of data, software, a system, or information.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-102(5): "Execute," when used with respect to computer software, means the performance of the functions or the carrying out of the instructions of the computer software.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-102(6): "False pretenses" means the representation of a fact or circumstance that is not true and is calculated to mislead.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-102(7): 
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-102(7)(a): "Identifying information" means any information that can be used to access a person's financial accounts or to obtain goods and services, including the person's:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-102(7)(a)(i): address;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-102(7)(a)(ii): birth date;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-102(7)(a)(iii): Social Security number;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-102(7)(a)(iv): driver license number;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-102(7)(a)(v): non-driver governmental identification number;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-102(7)(a)(vi): telephone number;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-102(7)(a)(vii): bank account number;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-102(7)(a)(viii): student identification number;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-102(7)(a)(ix): credit or debit card number;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-102(7)(a)(x): personal identification number;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-102(7)(a)(xi): unique biometric data;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-102(7)(a)(xii): employee or payroll number;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-102(7)(a)(xiii): automated or electronic signature;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-102(7)(a)(xiv): computer image file;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-102(7)(a)(xv): photograph; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-102(7)(a)(xvi): computer screen name or password.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-102(7)(b): "Identifying information" does not include information that is lawfully obtained from publicly available information, or from federal, state, or local government records lawfully made available to the general public.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-102(8): "Intentionally deceptive" means any of the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-102(8)(a): an intentionally and materially false or fraudulent statement;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-102(8)(b): a statement or description that intentionally omits or misrepresents material information in order to deceive an owner or operator of a computer; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-102(8)(c): an intentional and material failure to provide a notice to an owner or operator concerning the installation or execution of computer software, for the purpose of deceiving the owner or operator.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-102(9): "Internet" means the global information system that is logically linked together by a globally unique address space based on the Internet protocol (IP), or its subsequent extensions, and that is able to support communications using the transmission control protocol/Internet protocol (TCP/IP) suite, or its subsequent extensions, or other IP-compatible protocols, and that provides, uses, or makes accessible, either publicly or privately, high-level services layered on communications and related infrastructure.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-102(10): 76-10-1230; 76-10-1230 "Internet service provider" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-102(10)(a): 76-10-1230 an Internet service provider, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-102(10)(b): 76-10-1230 a hosting company, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-102(11): "Message" means a graphical or text communication presented to an authorized user of a computer.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-102(12): 
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-102(12)(a): "Owner or operator" means the owner or lessee of a computer, or a person using a computer with the owner's or lessee's authorization.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-102(12)(b): "Owner or operator" does not include a person who owned a computer before the first retail sale of the computer.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-102(13): "Person" means any individual, partnership, corporation, limited liability company, or other organization, or any combination thereof.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-102(14): "Personally identifiable information" means any of the following information if it allows the entity holding the information to identify the owner or operator of a computer:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-102(14)(a): the first name or first initial in combination with the last name and a home or other physical address including street name;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-102(14)(b): a personal identification code in conjunction with a password required to access an identified account, other than a password, personal identification number, or other identification number transmitted by an authorized user to the issuer of the account or its agent;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-102(14)(c): a Social Security number, tax identification number, driver license number, passport number, or any other government-issued identification number; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-102(14)(d): an account balance, overdraft history, or payment history that personally identifies an owner or operator of a computer.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-102(15): "Webpage" means a location that has a single uniform resource locator (URL) with respect to the World Wide Web or another location that can be accessed on the Internet.


Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-103 Application of chapter.
-------------------------------------------------------
This chapter applies to conduct involving a computer, software, or an advertisement located in, sent to, or displayed in this state.

Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-201 Phishing and pharming.
------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-201(1): A person is guilty of phishing if, with intent to defraud or injure an individual, or with knowledge that the person is facilitating a fraud or injury to be perpetrated by another:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-201(1)(a): the person makes a communication under false pretenses purporting to be by or on behalf of a legitimate business, without the authority or approval of the legitimate business; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-201(1)(b): the person uses the communication to induce, request, or solicit another person to provide identifying information or property.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-201(2): A person is guilty of pharming if, with intent to defraud or injure another, or with knowledge that the person is facilitating a fraud or injury to be perpetrated by another, the person:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-201(2)(a): creates or operates a webpage that represents itself as belonging to or being associated with a legitimate business, without the authority or approval of the legitimate business, if that webpage may induce any user of the Internet to provide identifying information or property; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-201(2)(b): alters a setting on a user's computer or similar device or software program through which the user may search the Internet, causing any user of the Internet to view a communication that represents itself as belonging to or being associated with a legitimate business, if the message has been created or is operated without the authority or approval of the legitimate business and induces, requests, or solicits any user of the Internet to provide identifying information or property.


Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-202 Removal of domain name or content -- Liability.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
If an Internet registrar or Internet service provider believes in good faith that an Internet domain name controlled or operated by the Internet registrar or Internet service provider, or content residing on an Internet website or other online location controlled or operated by the Internet registrar or Internet service provider, is used to engage in a violation of this part, the Internet registrar or Internet service provider is not liable under any provision of the laws of this state or of any political subdivision of the state for removing or disabling access to the Internet domain name or other content.

Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-203 Application of part.
----------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-203(1): This part applies to the discovery of a phishing or pharming incident that occurs on or after July 1, 2010.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-203(2): This part does not apply to a telecommunications provider's or Internet service provider's good faith transmission or routing of, or intermediate temporary storing or caching of, identifying information.


Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-204 Relation to other law.
------------------------------------------------------
The conduct prohibited by this part is of statewide concern, and this part's provisions supersede and preempt any provision of law of a political subdivision of the state.

Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-301 Prohibition on the use of software.
-------------------------------------------------------------------
A person who is not an owner or operator of a computer may not cause computer software to be copied on the computer knowingly, with conscious avoidance of actual knowledge, or willfully, if the software is used to:Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-301(1): modify, through intentionally deceptive means, settings of a computer controlling:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-301(1)(a): the webpage that appears when an owner or operator launches an Internet browser or similar computer software used to access and navigate the Internet;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-301(1)(b): the default provider or web proxy that an owner or operator uses to access or search the Internet; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-301(1)(c): an owner's or an operator's list of bookmarks used to access webpages;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-301(2): collect, through intentionally deceptive means, personally identifiable information:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-301(2)(a): through the use of a keystroke-logging function that records all or substantially all keystrokes made by an owner or operator of a computer and transfers that information from the computer to another person;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-301(2)(b): in a manner that correlates personally identifiable information with data concerning all or substantially all of the webpages visited by an owner or operator, other than webpages operated by the person providing the software, if the computer software was installed in a manner designed to conceal from all authorized users of the computer the fact that the software is being installed; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-301(2)(c): by extracting from the hard drive of an owner's or an operator's computer, an owner's or an operator's Social Security number, tax identification number, driver license number, passport number, any other government-issued identification number, an account balance, or overdraft history for a purpose unrelated to any of the purposes of the software or service described to an authorized user;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-301(3): prevent, through intentionally deceptive means, an owner's or an operator's reasonable efforts to block or disable the installation or execution of computer software by causing computer software that the owner or operator has properly removed or disabled to automatically reinstall or reactivate on the computer without the authorization of an authorized user;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-301(4): intentionally misrepresent that computer software will be uninstalled or disabled by an owner's or an operator's action;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-301(5): through intentionally deceptive means, remove, disable, or render inoperative security, antispyware, or antivirus computer software installed on an owner's or an operator's computer;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-301(6): 13-40-303 enable use of an owner's or an operator's computer to:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-301(6)(a): access or use a modem or Internet service for the purpose of causing damage to an owner's or an operator's computer or causing an owner or operator, or a third party affected by that conduct, to incur financial charges for a service that the owner or operator did not authorize;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-301(6)(b): 13-40-303 open multiple, sequential, stand-alone messages in an owner's or an operator's computer without the authorization of an owner or operator and with knowledge that a reasonable computer user could not close the messages without turning off the computer or closing the software application in which the messages appear, unless the communication originated from the computer's operating system, a software application the user activated, or a service provider that the user chose to use, or was presented for any of the purposes described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-301(6)(c): transmit or relay commercial electronic mail or a computer virus from the computer, if the transmission or relay is initiated by a person other than the authorized user without the authorization of an authorized user;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-301(7): (6) modify, without the authorization of an owner or operator, any of the following settings related the computer's access to, or use of, the Internet:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-301(7)(a): settings that protect information about an owner or operator for the purpose of taking personally identifiable information of the owner or operator;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-301(7)(b): security settings, for the purpose of causing damage to a computer; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-301(7)(c): (6) settings that protect the computer from the uses identified in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-301(8): prevent, without the authorization of an owner or operator, an owner's or an operator's reasonable efforts to block the installation of, or to disable, computer software by:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-301(8)(a): presenting the owner or operator with an option to decline installation of computer software with knowledge that, when the option is selected by the authorized user, the installation nevertheless proceeds;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-301(8)(b): falsely representing that computer software has been disabled;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-301(8)(c): requiring in an intentionally deceptive manner the user to access the Internet to remove the software with knowledge or reckless disregard of the fact that the software frequently operates in a manner that prevents the user from accessing the Internet;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-301(8)(d): changing the name, location, or other designation information of the software for the purpose of preventing an authorized user from locating the software to remove it;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-301(8)(e): using randomized or intentionally deceptive filenames, directory folders, formats, or registry entries for the purpose of avoiding detection and removal of the software by an authorized user;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-301(8)(f): causing the installation of software in a particular computer directory or in computer memory for the purpose of evading an authorized user's attempt to remove the software from the computer; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-301(8)(g): requiring, without the authority of the owner of the computer, that an authorized user obtain a special code or download software from a third party to uninstall the software.


Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-302 Other prohibited conduct.
---------------------------------------------------------
A person who is not an owner or operator of a computer may not, with regard to the computer:Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-302(1): induce an owner or operator to install a computer software component onto the owner's or the operator's computer by intentionally misrepresenting that installing the computer software is necessary for security or privacy reasons or in order to open, view, or play a particular type of content; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-40-302(2): use intentionally deceptive means to cause the execution of a computer software component with the intent of causing the computer to use the computer software component in a manner that violates any other provision of this chapter.

Utah Code Annotated - Title 13 - Chapter 41 - Price Controls During Emergencies Act
***********************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-101 Title.
--------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Price Controls During Emergencies Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-102 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
For purposes of this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-102(1): "Consumer" means a person who seeks to acquire or acquires a good or service for consumption.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-102(2): "Division" means the Division of Consumer Protection.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-102(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-102(3)(a): "Emergency territory" means the geographical area:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-102(3)(a)(i): for which there has been a state of emergency declared; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-102(3)(a)(ii): that is directly affected by the events giving rise to a state of emergency.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-102(3)(b): "Emergency territory" does not include a geographical area that is affected by the events giving rise to a state of emergency only by economic market forces.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-102(4): "Excessive price" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-102(4)(a): for a person that sold the good or provided the service in the 30-day period immediately preceding the day on which a state of emergency is declared:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-102(4)(a)(i): a price for a good or service that exceeds by more than 10% the highest price the person charged for the good or service in the 30-day period immediately preceding the day on which the state of emergency is declared; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-102(4)(a)(ii): if the person's total cost for the good or service exceeds the average total cost to the person for the good or service in the 30-day period immediately preceding the day on which the state of emergency is declared, a price that exceeds by more than 10% the sum of:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-102(4)(a)(ii)(A): the total cost to the person for the good or service; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-102(4)(a)(ii)(B): the person's customary margin; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-102(4)(b): for a person that did not sell the good or provide the service in the 30-day period immediately preceding the day on which a state of emergency is declared, a price for a good or service that is more than twice the person's total cost for the good or service.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-102(5): "Good" means any personal property displayed, held, or offered for sale by a merchant that is necessary for consumption or use as a direct result of events giving rise to a state of emergency.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-102(6): "Margin" means the difference between the sale price and the total cost of the good or service.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-102(7): "Retail" means the level of distribution where a good or service is typically sold directly, or otherwise provided, to a member of the public who is an end user and does not resell the good or service.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-102(8): "Service" means any activity that is performed in whole or in part for the purpose of financial gain including personal service, professional service, rental, leasing, or licensing for use that is necessary for consumption or use as a direct result of events giving rise to a state of emergency.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-102(9): 53-2a-206 "State of emergency" means a declaration of:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-102(9)(a): an emergency or major disaster by the president of the United States of America; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-102(9)(b): 53-2a-206 a state of emergency by the governor under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-102(10): 
Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-102(10)(a): "Total cost" means an amount equal to:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-102(10)(a)(i): the sum of all costs associated with a person obtaining a product or service and providing the product or service to a consumer, including fees, shipping, or employee labor; minus
Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-102(10)(a)(ii): any trade discount, cash discount, or manufacturer rebate.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-102(10)(b): "Total cost" does not include an amount that incorporates an ongoing cost to operate a business that is not directly associated with a good or service.


Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-201 Excessive price prohibited.
-----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-201(1): (1); (1)(a) A person may not offer for sale, offer to provide, sell, or provide a good or service to a consumer at an excessive price, if:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-201(1)(a): a state of emergency exists; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-201(1)(b): (1); (1)(a) the person offers for sale, offers to provide, sells, or provides the good or service at retail:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-201(1)(b)(i): (1); (1)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-201(1)(b)(i)(A): (1) during the time period for which a state of emergency declared by the governor exists, if the state of emergency described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-201(1)(b)(i)(B): (1)(a) for 30 days after the day on which the state of emergency begins, if the state of emergency described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-201(1)(b)(ii): within the emergency territory.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-201(2): (1); (1)(a); (2)(a); (1)(a) A person may offer for sale, offer to provide, sell, or provide a good or service as otherwise prohibited under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-201(2)(a): (1)(a) the good or service is identical, similar, or comparable in nature to a good or service that the person sold or provided in the 30-day period immediately preceding the day on which the state of emergency described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-201(2)(b): (2)(a); (1)(a) the person applies the same margin to the good or service as the margin applied to the identical, similar, or comparable good or service described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-201(3): Upon request of the division, a person allegedly offering for sale, offering to provide, selling, or providing a good or service at an excessive price in accordance with this chapter shall provide documentation to the division that the person is in compliance with this chapter.


Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-202 Enforcement -- Penalty.
-------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-202(1): The division shall enforce this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-202(2): In determining whether to investigate, contact, or request information from a person in the enforcement of this chapter, the division shall consider:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-202(2)(a): whether a complaint, information, or evidence reasonably justifies further division inquiry;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-202(2)(b): the burden contact, investigation, or providing information places on the person;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-202(2)(c): the result of a previous investigation of the person, including whether the previous investigation suggests that the person did not violate this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-202(2)(d): whether the person may benefit from receiving information about requirements under this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-202(2)(e): the potential gravity of harm to consumers, considering price, availability, and volume of a good or service.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-202(3): In enforcing this chapter, the division may not publicly disclose the identity of a person the division investigates unless:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-202(3)(a): the person's identity is a matter of public record in an enforcement proceeding; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-202(3)(b): the person consents to public disclosure.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-202(4): In determining whether to impose penalties against a person who violates this chapter, the division shall consider:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-202(4)(a): the person's cost of doing business not accounted for in the total cost to the person for the good or service, including costs associated with a decrease in the supply available to a person who relies on a high volume of sales;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-202(4)(b): the person's efforts to comply with this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-202(4)(c): whether the average price charged by the person during the 30-day period immediately preceding the day on which the state of emergency is declared is artificially deflated because the good or service was on sale for a lower price than the person customarily charges for the good or service; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-202(4)(d): any other factor that the division considers appropriate.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-202(5): (5); 13-41-201; (5)
Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-202(5)(a): (5) If the division finds that a person has violated, or is violating, this chapter, the division may:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-202(5)(a)(i): issue a cease and desist order; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-202(5)(a)(ii): (5) subject to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-202(5)(b): 13-41-201; (5) Each instance of charging an excessive price under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-202(6): (5) The division may sue in a court of competent jurisdiction to enforce an order under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-202(7): (5) In a suit brought under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-202(7)(a): court costs;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-202(7)(b): attorney fees; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-202(7)(c): the division's costs incurred in the investigation of the violation of this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-41-202(8): 13-2-8 All money received through an administrative fine imposed, or judgment obtained, under this section shall be deposited in the Consumer Protection Education and Training Fund created by Section


Utah Code Annotated - Title 13 - Chapter 42 - Uniform Debt-Management Services Act
**********************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-101 Title.
--------------------------------------
This chapter shall be known as the "Uniform Debt-Management Services Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-102 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
In this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-102(1): "Administrator" means the Division of Consumer Protection.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-102(2): 13-42-132(6); (2)(b)(i); (2)(b)(i); (v); (2)(a)(iv); (2)(b)(i); (v) "Affiliate":
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-102(2)(a): with respect to an individual, means:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-102(2)(a)(i): the spouse of the individual;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-102(2)(a)(ii): a sibling of the individual or the spouse of a sibling;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-102(2)(a)(iii): an individual or the spouse of an individual who is a lineal ancestor or lineal descendant of the individual or the individual's spouse;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-102(2)(a)(iv): an aunt, uncle, great aunt, great uncle, first cousin, niece, nephew, grandniece, or grandnephew, whether related by the whole or the half blood or adoption, or the spouse of any of them; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-102(2)(a)(v): any other individual occupying the residence of the individual; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-102(2)(b): 13-42-132(6); (2)(b)(i); (2)(b)(i); (v); (2)(a)(iv); (2)(b)(i); (v) with respect to an entity, means:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-102(2)(b)(i): a person that directly or indirectly controls, is controlled by, or is under common control with the entity;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-102(2)(b)(ii): an officer of, or an individual performing similar functions with respect to, the entity;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-102(2)(b)(iii): a director of, or an individual performing similar functions with respect to, the entity;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-102(2)(b)(iv): 13-42-132(6) subject to adjustment of the dollar amount pursuant to Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-102(2)(b)(v): (2)(b)(i) an officer or director of, or an individual performing similar functions with respect to, a person described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-102(2)(b)(vi): (2)(b)(i); (v) the spouse of, or an individual occupying the residence of, an individual described in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-102(2)(b)(vii): (2)(a)(iv); (2)(b)(i); (v) an individual who has the relationship specified in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-102(3): "Agreement" means an agreement between a provider and an individual for the performance of debt-management services.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-102(4): "Bank" means a financial institution, including a commercial bank, savings bank, savings and loan association, credit union, and trust company, engaged in the business of banking, chartered under federal or state law, and regulated by a federal or state banking regulatory authority.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-102(5): "Business address" means the physical location of a business, including the name and number of a street.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-102(6): "Certified counselor" means an individual certified by a training program or certifying organization, approved by the administrator, that authenticates the competence of individuals providing education and assistance to other individuals in connection with debt-management services.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-102(7): "Concessions" means assent to repayment of a debt on terms more favorable to an individual than the terms of the contract between the individual and a creditor.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-102(8): "Day" means calendar day.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-102(9): "Debt-management services" means services as an intermediary between an individual and one or more creditors of the individual for the purpose of obtaining concessions, but does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-102(9)(a): legal services provided in an attorney-client relationship if:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-102(9)(a)(i): the services are provided by an attorney who:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-102(9)(a)(i)(A): is licensed or otherwise authorized to practice law in this state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-102(9)(a)(i)(B): provides legal services in representing the individual in the individual's relationship with a creditor; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-102(9)(a)(ii): there is no intermediary between the individual and the creditor other than the attorney or an individual under the direct supervision of the attorney;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-102(9)(b): accounting services provided in an accountant-client relationship if:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-102(9)(b)(i): the services are provided by a certified public accountant who:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-102(9)(b)(i)(A): is licensed to provide accounting services in this state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-102(9)(b)(i)(B): provides accounting services in representing the individual in the individual's relationship with a creditor; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-102(9)(b)(ii): there is no intermediary between the individual and the creditor other than the accountant or an individual under the direct supervision of the accountant; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-102(9)(c): financial-planning services provided in a financial planner-client relationship by a member of a financial-planning profession if:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-102(9)(c)(i): the administrator, by rule, determines that members are:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-102(9)(c)(i)(A): licensed by this state;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-102(9)(c)(i)(B): subject to a disciplinary mechanism;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-102(9)(c)(i)(C): subject to a code of professional responsibility; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-102(9)(c)(i)(D): subject to a continuing education requirement; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-102(9)(c)(ii): there is no intermediary between the individual and the creditor other than the financial planner or an individual under the direct supervision of the financial planner.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-102(10): "Entity" means a person other than an individual.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-102(11): "Good faith" means honesty in fact and the observance of reasonable standards of fair dealing.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-102(12): "Lead generator" means a person who, in the regular course of business, supplies a provider with the name of a potential customer, directs a communication of an individual to a provider, or otherwise refers a customer to a provider.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-102(13): "Person" means an individual, corporation, business trust, estate, trust, partnership, limited liability company, association, joint venture, or any other legal or commercial entity.  The term does not include a public corporation, government, or governmental subdivision, agency, or instrumentality.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-102(14): "Plan" means a program or strategy in which a provider furnishes debt-management services to an individual and which includes a schedule of payments to be made by or on behalf of the individual and used to pay debts owed by the individual.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-102(15): "Principal amount of the debt" means the amount of a debt at the time of an agreement.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-102(16): "Provider" means a person that provides, offers to provide, or agrees to provide debt-management services directly or through others.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-102(17): "Record" means information that is inscribed on a tangible medium or that is stored in an electronic or other medium and is retrievable in perceivable form.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-102(18): "Settlement fee" means a charge imposed on or paid by an individual in connection with a creditor's assent to accept in full satisfaction of a debt an amount less than the principal amount of the debt.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-102(19): "Sign" means, with present intent to authenticate or adopt a record:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-102(19)(a): to execute or adopt a tangible symbol; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-102(19)(b): to attach to or logically associate with the record an electronic sound, symbol, or process.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-102(20): "State" means a state of the United States, the District of Columbia, Puerto Rico, the United States Virgin Islands, or any territory or insular possession subject to the jurisdiction of the United States.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-102(21): "Trust account" means an account held by a provider that is:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-102(21)(a): established in a bank in which deposit accounts are insured;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-102(21)(b): separate from other accounts of the provider or its designee;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-102(21)(c): designated as a trust account or other account designated to indicate that the money in the account is not the money of the provider or its designee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-102(21)(d): used to hold money of one or more individuals for disbursement to creditors of the individuals.


Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-103 Exempt agreements and persons.
--------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-103(1): This chapter does not apply to an agreement with an individual who the provider has no reason to know resides in this state at the time of the agreement.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-103(2): This chapter does not apply to a provider to the extent that the provider:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-103(2)(a): provides or agrees to provide debt-management, educational, or counseling services to an individual who the provider has no reason to know resides in this state at the time the provider agrees to provide the services; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-103(2)(b): receives no compensation for debt-management services from or on behalf of the individuals to whom it provides the services or from their creditors.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-103(3): 13-42-102(2)(b)(i) This chapter does not apply to the following persons or their employees when the person or the employee is engaged in the regular course of the person's business or profession:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-103(3)(a): a judicial officer, a person acting under an order of a court or an administrative agency, or an assignee for the benefit of creditors;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-103(3)(b): a bank;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-103(3)(c): 13-42-102(2)(b)(i) an affiliate, as defined in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-103(3)(d): a title insurer, escrow company, or other person that provides bill-paying services if the provision of debt-management services is incidental to the bill-paying services.

Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-115 Requirement of good faith.
----------------------------------------------------------
A provider shall act in good faith in all matters under this chapter.

Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-116 Customer service.
-------------------------------------------------
A provider that is required to be registered under this chapter shall maintain a toll-free communication system, staffed at a level that reasonably permits an individual to speak to a certified counselor or customer service representative, as appropriate, during ordinary business hours.

Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-117 Prerequisites for providing debt-management services.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-117(1): Before providing debt-management services, a provider shall give the individual an itemized list of goods and services and the charges for each.  The list shall be clear and conspicuous, be in a record the individual may keep whether or not the individual assents to an agreement, and describe the goods and services the provider offers:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-117(1)(a): free of additional charge if the individual enters into an agreement;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-117(1)(b): for a charge if the individual does not enter into an agreement; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-117(1)(c): for a charge if the individual enters into an agreement, using the following terminology, as applicable, and format:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-117(2): A provider may not furnish debt-management services unless the provider, through the services of a certified counselor:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-117(2)(a): provides the individual with reasonable education about the management of personal finance;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-117(2)(b): has prepared a financial analysis including at least the following matters affecting the individual's financial condition:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-117(2)(b)(i): assets;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-117(2)(b)(ii): income;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-117(2)(b)(iii): debt, including secured debt; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-117(2)(b)(iv): other liabilities; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-117(2)(c): if the individual is to make regular, periodic payments to a creditor or a provider:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-117(2)(c)(i): has prepared a plan for the individual;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-117(2)(c)(ii): has made a determination, based on the provider's analysis of the information provided by the individual and otherwise available to it, that the plan is suitable for the individual and the individual will be able to meet the payment obligations under the plan; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-117(2)(c)(iii): believes that each creditor of the individual listed as a participating creditor in the plan will accept payment of the individual's debts as provided in the plan.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-117(3): (2); (2) Before an individual assents to an agreement to engage in a plan, a provider shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-117(3)(a): (2) provide the individual with a copy of the analysis and plan required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-117(3)(b): (2) inform the individual of the availability, at the individual's option, of assistance by a toll-free communication system or in person to discuss the financial analysis and plan required by Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-117(3)(c): with respect to all creditors identified by the individual or otherwise known by the provider to be creditors of the individual, provide the individual with a list of:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-117(3)(c)(i): creditors that the provider expects to participate in the plan and grant concessions;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-117(3)(c)(ii): creditors that the provider expects to participate in the plan but not grant concessions;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-117(3)(c)(iii): creditors that the provider expects not to participate in the plan; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-117(3)(c)(iv): all other creditors.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-117(4): 13-42-123 Before an individual assents to an agreement, the provider shall inform the individual, in a separate record that the individual may keep whether or not the individual assents to the agreement:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-117(4)(a): of the name and business address of the provider;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-117(4)(b): that plans are not suitable for all individuals and the individual may ask the provider about other ways, including bankruptcy, to deal with indebtedness;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-117(4)(c): of the amount of time necessary to achieve the results that the provider represents to be achievable;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-117(4)(d): if the provider intends to include a settlement offer to any of the individual's creditors or debt collectors:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-117(4)(d)(i): of the time by which the provider will make a bona fide settlement offer to any of the individual's creditors or debt collectors; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-117(4)(d)(ii): of the amount of money or the percentage of each outstanding debt that the individual must accumulate before the provider will make a bona fide settlement offer to each creditor or debt collector;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-117(4)(e): that establishment of a plan may adversely affect the individual's credit rating or credit scores;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-117(4)(f): that nonpayment of debt may lead creditors to increase finance and other charges or undertake collection activity, including litigation;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-117(4)(g): 13-42-123 if the provider requests or requires the individual to place money in an account at an insured financial institution, that the individual:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-117(4)(g)(i): owns the funds held in the account;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-117(4)(g)(ii): may withdraw from the provider's plan at any time without penalty; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-117(4)(g)(iii): 13-42-123 is entitled to receive all money in the account, other than money that the provider earns as provided in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-117(4)(h): unless it is not true, that the provider may receive compensation from the creditors of the individual; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-117(4)(i): that, unless the individual is insolvent, if a creditor settles for less than the full amount of the debt, the plan may result in the creation of taxable income to the individual, even though the individual does not receive any money.

Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-119 Form and contents of agreement.
---------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-119(1): 13-42-127(1) An agreement shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-119(1)(a): be in a record;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-119(1)(b): be dated and signed by the provider and the individual;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-119(1)(c): include the name of the individual and the address where the individual resides;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-119(1)(d): include the name, business address, and telephone number of the provider;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-119(1)(e): be delivered to the individual immediately upon formation of the agreement; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-119(1)(f): 13-42-127(1) disclose:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-119(1)(f)(i): the services to be provided;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-119(1)(f)(ii): the amount, or method of determining the amount, of all fees, individually itemized, to be paid by the individual;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-119(1)(f)(iii): the schedule of payments to be made by or on behalf of the individual, including the amount of each payment, the date on which each payment is due, and an estimate of the date of the final payment;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-119(1)(f)(iv): if a plan provides for regular periodic payments to creditors:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-119(1)(f)(iv)(A): each creditor of the individual to which payment will be made, the amount owed to each creditor, and any concessions the provider reasonably believes each creditor will offer;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-119(1)(f)(iv)(B): the schedule of expected payments to each creditor, including the amount of each payment and the date on which it will be made;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-119(1)(f)(iv)(C): each creditor that the provider believes will not participate in the plan and to which the provider will not direct payment; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-119(1)(f)(iv)(D): that the provider may terminate the agreement for good cause, upon return of unexpended money of the individual;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-119(1)(f)(v): if a plan contemplates the settlement of the individual's debt for less than the principal amount of the debt, an estimate of:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-119(1)(f)(v)(A): the duration of the plan based on all enrolled debts;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-119(1)(f)(v)(B): the length of time before the individual may reasonably expect a settlement offer; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-119(1)(f)(v)(C): the amount of savings needed to accrue before the individual may reasonably expect a settlement offer, expressed as either a dollar amount or a percentage, for each enrolled debt;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-119(1)(f)(vi): 13-42-127(1) how the provider will comply with its obligations under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-119(1)(f)(vii): that the individual may terminate the agreement at any time by giving written or electronic notice, and that, if notice of termination is given, the individual will receive all unexpended money that the provider or its designee has received from or on behalf of the individual for payment of a credit and, except to the extent they have been earned, the provider's fees;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-119(1)(f)(viii): that the individual may contact the administrator with any questions or complaints regarding the provider; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-119(1)(f)(ix): the address, telephone number, and Internet address or website of the administrator.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-119(2): (1)(e) For purposes of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-119(3): (1)(f)(ix) If the administrator supplies the provider with any information required under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-119(4): An agreement shall provide that:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-119(4)(a): the individual authorizes any bank in which the provider or its agent has established a trust account to disclose to the administrator any financial records relating to the trust account; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-119(4)(b): the provider will notify the individual no later than five business days after learning of a creditor's final decision to reject or withdraw from a plan and that this notice will include:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-119(4)(b)(i): the identity of the creditor; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-42-119(4)(b)(ii): the right of the individual to modify or terminate the agreement.
