Utah Code Annotated § 13-47-101 Title.
--------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Private Employer Verification Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 13-47-102 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 13-47-102(1): "Department" means the Department of Commerce.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-47-102(2): "Employee" means an individual:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-47-102(2)(a): who is hired to perform services in Utah; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-47-102(2)(b): to whom a private employer provides a federal form required for federal taxation purposes to report income paid to the individual for the services performed.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-47-102(3): (3)(b); 63G-12-102
Utah Code Annotated § 13-47-102(3)(a): (3)(b) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 13-47-102(3)(a)(i): to an individual who performs services for the person in Utah; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-47-102(3)(a)(ii): to report income paid to the individual who performs the services.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-47-102(3)(b): 63G-12-102 "Private employer" does not mean a public employer as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 13-47-102(4): (4)(b)(i); (4)(b)(i); (ii); (iii)
Utah Code Annotated § 13-47-102(4)(a): "Status verification system" means an electronic system operated by the federal government, through which an employer may inquire to verify the federal legal working status of an individual who is a newly hired employee.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-47-102(4)(b): (4)(b)(i); (4)(b)(i); (ii); (iii) "Status verification system" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-47-102(4)(b)(i): the electronic verification of the work authorization program of the Illegal Immigration Reform and Immigrant Responsibility Act of 1996, 8 U.S.C. Sec. 1324a;

Utah Code Annotated § 13-47-102(4)(b)(iv): (4)(b)(i); (ii); (iii) an independent third-party system with an equal or higher degree of reliability as the programs, systems, or processes described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 13-47-103 Scope of chapter.
-------------------------------------------------
A private employer shall comply with this chapter, and this chapter shall be enforced without regard to race, color, national origin, gender, religion, age, disability, familial status, or source of income.

Utah Code Annotated § 13-47-201 Verification required for new hires.
--------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-47-201(1): A private employer who employs 150 or more employees on or after May 4, 2022, may not hire a new employee on or after May 4, 2022, unless the private employer:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-47-201(1)(a): is registered with a status verification system to verify the federal legal working status of any new employee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-47-201(1)(b): uses the status verification system to verify the federal legal working status of the new employee in accordance with the requirements of the status verification system.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-47-201(2): This section does not apply to a private employer of a foreign national if the foreign national holds a visa issued in response to a petition by the private employer that is classified as H-2A or H-2B.


Utah Code Annotated § 13-47-202 Liability protections.
------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-47-202(1): 13-47-201 A private employer may not be held civilly liable under state law in a cause of action for the private employer's unlawful hiring of an unauthorized alien, as defined in 8 U.S.C. Sec. 1324a, if:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-47-202(1)(a): 13-47-201 the private employer complies with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 13-47-202(1)(b): the information obtained in accordance with the status verification system indicated that the employee's federal legal status allowed the private employer to hire the employee.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-47-202(2): 13-47-201 A private employer may not be held civilly liable under state law in a cause of action for the private employer's refusal to hire an individual if:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-47-202(2)(a): 13-47-201 the private employer complies with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 13-47-202(2)(b): the information obtained in accordance with the status system verification indicated that the individual's federal legal status was that of an unauthorized alien as defined in 8 U.S.C. Sec. 1324a.

Utah Code Annotated - Title 13 - Chapter 48 - Motor Vehicle Rental Company Disclosure Act
*****************************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 13-48-101 Title.
--------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Motor Vehicle Rental Company Disclosure Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 13-48-102 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 13-48-102(1): "Motor vehicle license cost recovery fee" means a fee or charge that may be separately stated and charged on the short-term motor vehicle lease or rental contract in a motor vehicle lease or rental transaction originating in this state to recover the costs incurred by a motor vehicle rental company to license, title, register, obtain license plates for, and inspect rental motor vehicles.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48-102(2): "Motor vehicle rental company" means any person or organization in the business of renting motor vehicles to the public.


Utah Code Annotated § 13-48-103 Motor vehicle rental company -- Fee disclosure and collection requirements.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48-103(1): A motor vehicle rental company may include separately stated surcharges, fees, or charges in a rental agreement, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48-103(1)(a): motor vehicle license cost recovery fees;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48-103(1)(b): airport access fees;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48-103(1)(c): airport concession fees; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48-103(1)(d): all applicable taxes.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48-103(2): If a motor vehicle rental company includes a motor vehicle license cost recovery fee as a separately stated charge in a rental transaction, the amount of the fee shall represent the motor vehicle rental company's good-faith estimate of the motor vehicle rental company's daily charge as calculated by the motor vehicle rental company to recover its actual total annual motor vehicle titling, registration, obtaining license plates, and motor vehicle inspection and emission costs.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48-103(3): If the total amount of the motor vehicle license cost recovery fees collected by a motor vehicle rental company under this section in any calendar year exceeds the motor vehicle rental company's actual costs to license, title, register, and obtain license plates for the motor vehicles and have the motor vehicles pass inspections and emissions for that calendar year, the motor vehicle rental company shall retain the excess amount and adjust the estimated average per motor vehicle license cost recovery fee for the following calendar year by the corresponding amount.


Utah Code Annotated § 13-48-103 Motor vehicle rental company -- Fee disclosure and collection requirements.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48-103(1): A motor vehicle rental company may include separately stated surcharges, fees, or charges in a rental agreement, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48-103(1)(a): motor vehicle license cost recovery fees;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48-103(1)(b): airport access fees;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48-103(1)(c): airport concession fees; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48-103(1)(d): all applicable taxes.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48-103(2): If a motor vehicle rental company includes a motor vehicle license cost recovery fee as a separately stated charge in a rental transaction, the amount of the fee shall represent the motor vehicle rental company's good-faith estimate of the motor vehicle rental company's daily charge as calculated by the motor vehicle rental company to recover its actual total annual motor vehicle titling, registration, obtaining a license plate, and motor vehicle inspection and emission costs.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48-103(3): If the total amount of the motor vehicle license cost recovery fees collected by a motor vehicle rental company under this section in any calendar year exceeds the motor vehicle rental company's actual costs to license, title, register, and obtain a license plate for the motor vehicles and have the motor vehicles pass inspections and emissions for that calendar year, the motor vehicle rental company shall retain the excess amount and adjust the estimated average per motor vehicle license cost recovery fee for the following calendar year by the corresponding amount.


Utah Code Annotated - Title 13 - Chapter 48a - Car-Sharing Programs
*******************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-101 Definitions.
---------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-101(1): 31A-22-311
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-101(1)(a): "Car sharing" means the authorized use of a motor vehicle:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-101(1)(a)(i): by an individual other than the owner of the motor vehicle; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-101(1)(a)(ii): through a peer-to-peer car-sharing program.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-101(1)(b): 31A-22-311 "Car sharing" does not mean the business of providing private passenger motor vehicles to the public as used in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-101(2): 31A-22-311; 59-12-102
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-101(2)(a): "Car-sharing agreement" means an agreement:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-101(2)(a)(i): applicable to a shared vehicle owner and a shared vehicle driver; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-101(2)(a)(ii): that governs a shared vehicle driver's use of a shared vehicle through a car-sharing program.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-101(2)(b): 31A-22-311; 59-12-102 "Car-sharing agreement" does not mean:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-101(2)(b)(i): 31A-22-311 a rental agreement, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-101(2)(b)(ii): 59-12-102 a short-term rental as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-101(3): "Car-sharing delivery period" means the period of time during which a shared vehicle is being delivered to the location of the car-sharing start time, if applicable, as documented by the governing car-sharing agreement.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-101(4): "Car-sharing period" means the period of time that:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-101(4)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-101(4)(a)(i): begins at the car-sharing delivery period; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-101(4)(a)(ii): if there is no car-sharing delivery period, begins at the car-sharing start time; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-101(4)(b): ends at the car-sharing termination time.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-101(5): 13-48-102; 31A-22-311
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-101(5)(a): "Car-sharing program" or "peer-to-peer car-sharing program" means a business platform that connects motor vehicle owners with drivers to enable the sharing of motor vehicles for consideration.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-101(5)(b): 13-48-102; 31A-22-311 "Car-sharing program" does not mean:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-101(5)(b)(i): 13-48-102 a motor vehicle rental company, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-101(5)(b)(ii): 31A-22-311 a rental company, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-101(6): "Car-sharing start time" means the time when a shared vehicle becomes subject to the control of the shared vehicle driver at or after the time the reservation of the shared vehicle is scheduled to begin, as documented in the records of the car-sharing program.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-101(7): "Car-sharing termination time" means the earliest of the following events:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-101(7)(a): the expiration of the agreed upon period of time established for the use of a shared vehicle according to the terms of the car-sharing agreement, if the shared vehicle is delivered to the location agreed upon in the car-sharing agreement;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-101(7)(b): when the shared vehicle is returned to a location as alternatively agreed upon by the shared vehicle owner and shared vehicle driver as communicated through a car-sharing program, which alternatively agreed upon location shall be incorporated into the car-sharing agreement; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-101(7)(c): when the shared vehicle owner or shared vehicle owner's authorized designee takes possession and control of the shared vehicle.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-101(8): "Individual-owned shared vehicle" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-101(8)(a): for a motor vehicle purchased in the state, a shared vehicle for which applicable sales tax and use tax was paid on the purchase; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-101(8)(b): for a motor vehicle not purchased in the state, a shared vehicle for which:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-101(8)(b)(i): an applicable use tax was paid to this state on the purchase; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-101(8)(b)(ii): sales tax or use tax was paid on the purchase in the jurisdiction in which the motor vehicle was purchased.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-101(9): 41-1a-102 "Motor vehicle" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-101(10): "Shared vehicle" means a motor vehicle that is available for use by an individual other than the shared vehicle owner through a car-sharing program.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-101(11): 31A-22-311
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-101(11)(a): "Shared vehicle driver" means an individual who has been authorized to drive a shared vehicle by the shared vehicle owner under a car-sharing program.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-101(11)(b): 31A-22-311 "Shared vehicle driver" does not mean a renter, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-101(12): 31A-22-311
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-101(12)(a): "Shared vehicle owner" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-101(12)(a)(i): the registered owner of a motor vehicle made available for car sharing; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-101(12)(a)(ii): a person designated by the registered owner of a motor vehicle made available for car sharing.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-101(12)(b): 31A-22-311 "Shared vehicle owner" does not mean a rental company, as defined in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-102 Limits on reach of chapter.
------------------------------------------------------------
Nothing in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-102(1): limits the liability of a car-sharing program for an act or omission of the car-sharing program that results in injury to a person as a result of the use of a shared vehicle through a car-sharing program; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-102(2): limits the ability of the car-sharing program, by contract, to seek indemnification from the shared vehicle owner or the shared vehicle driver for economic loss sustained by the car-sharing program resulting from a breach of the terms and conditions of the car-sharing agreement.


Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-201 Notification about possible violation of lienholder agreement.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-201(1): As used in this section, "lienholder agreement" means an agreement between the owner of a motor vehicle and another person under which the other person has a lien against the motor vehicle.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-201(2): At the time that the owner of a motor vehicle registers to make the owner's motor vehicle available for sharing through a car-sharing program, the car-sharing program shall notify the owner that the use of the owner's motor vehicle through the car-sharing program, including without physical damage coverage, may violate the terms of a lienholder agreement that the motor vehicle may be subject to.


Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-202 Safety recalls.
------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-202(1): (2); (3); (4) At the time that the owner of a motor vehicle registers to make the owner's motor vehicle available for sharing through a car-sharing program, the car-sharing program shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-202(1)(a): verify that the shared vehicle does not have any safety recalls for which the repairs have not been made; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-202(1)(b): (2); (3); (4) notify the motor vehicle owner of the requirements under Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-202(2): An owner of a motor vehicle may not register to make the owner's motor vehicle available for sharing through a car-sharing program if:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-202(2)(a): the owner has received an actual notice of a safety recall applicable to the motor vehicle; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-202(2)(b): the safety recall repair has not been made.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-202(3): A shared vehicle owner who receives an actual notice of a safety recall applicable to the shared vehicle during the time that the shared vehicle is made available for sharing through a car-sharing program shall, as soon as practicably possible after receiving the notice, remove the shared vehicle from availability for sharing through the car-sharing program until the safety recall repair is made.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-202(4): A shared vehicle owner who receives an actual notice of a safety recall applicable to the shared vehicle during the time that the shared vehicle is in the possession of a shared vehicle driver under a car-sharing agreement shall, as soon as practicably possible after receiving the notice, notify the car-sharing program about the safety recall so that the shared vehicle owner may address the safety recall repair.


Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-203 Required disclosures for a car-sharing agreement.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
A car-sharing agreement shall disclose to the shared vehicle owner and the shared vehicle driver:Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-203(1): a right of the car-sharing company to seek indemnification from the shared vehicle owner or shared vehicle driver for economic loss resulting from a breach of the car-sharing agreement;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-203(2): that a motor vehicle liability insurance policy issued to the shared vehicle owner or shared vehicle driver does not provide a defense or indemnification for any claim asserted by the car-sharing company;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-203(3): that the car-sharing program's insurance policy covering the shared vehicle owner and the shared vehicle driver is in effect only during the car-sharing period and that, for any use of the shared vehicle by the shared vehicle driver after the car-sharing termination time, the shared vehicle driver and the shared vehicle owner may not have insurance coverage;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-203(4): of the daily rate, fees, and, if applicable, insurance or protection package costs that are charged to the shared vehicle owner or shared vehicle driver;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-203(5): that the shared vehicle owner's motor vehicle liability insurance policy may not provide coverage for the shared vehicle;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-203(6): of an emergency telephone number to contact personnel capable of fielding roadside assistance or other customer service inquiries; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-203(7): whether there are conditions under which a shared vehicle driver must maintain a personal automobile insurance policy with certain applicable coverage limits on a primary basis in order to book a shared vehicle.


Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-204 Records relating to the use of shared vehicles.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-204(1): A car-sharing program shall collect and verify records pertaining to the use of a shared vehicle, including times used, car-sharing period pick up and drop off locations, fees paid by the shared vehicle driver, and revenues received by the shared vehicle owner, and provide that information upon request to the shared vehicle owner, the shared vehicle owner's insurer, or the shared vehicle driver's insurer to facilitate a claim coverage investigation, settlement, negotiation, or litigation.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-204(2): The car-sharing program shall retain the records for a time period not less than two years.


Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-205 GPS or other special equipment.
----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-205(1): (1)(a) A car-sharing program:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-205(1)(a): has sole responsibility for any GPS or other special equipment that the car-sharing company places on or in a shared vehicle to monitor the shared vehicle or facilitate the car-sharing agreement; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-205(1)(b): (1)(a) shall agree to indemnify and hold harmless the shared vehicle owner for any damage to the shared vehicle that:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-205(1)(b)(i): (1)(a) is a result of damage to or theft of equipment described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-205(1)(b)(ii): occurs during the car-sharing period; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-205(1)(b)(iii): is not caused by the shared vehicle owner.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-205(2): (1)(a) A car-sharing program may seek indemnity from a shared vehicle driver for any loss of or damage to equipment described in Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-303 Certain abilities of insurance companies preserved.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-303(1): (1); 31A-22-305; 31A-22-305.5; 31A-22-307
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-303(1)(a): A motor vehicle liability insurance policy may exclude coverage and a duty to defend or indemnify with respect to a claim arising during a motor vehicle's use as a shared vehicle, based on the motor vehicle's use as a shared vehicle.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-303(1)(b): (1); 31A-22-305; 31A-22-305.5; 31A-22-307 Coverage that may be excluded as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-303(1)(b)(i): bodily injury or property damage suffered by a third party;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-303(1)(b)(ii): 31A-22-305 a claim covered by uninsured motorist coverage described in Section

Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-303(1)(b)(vi): a claim for comprehensive physical damage; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-303(1)(b)(vii): a claim for collision physical damage.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-303(2): Nothing in this chapter invalidates, limits, or restricts the ability of an insurance company under other applicable law to:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-303(2)(a): underwrite an insurance policy; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-303(2)(b): cancel or fail to renew an insurance policy.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-303(3): Nothing in this chapter invalidates or limits a provision in a motor vehicle liability insurance policy, including any insurance policy in use or approved for use, that excludes coverage for a motor vehicle made available for rent, sharing, hire, or any business use.


Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-304 Insurable interest -- Insurance to cover various liabilities -- No liability to maintain certain insurance.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-304(1): Notwithstanding any other provision of law, a car-sharing program has an insurable interest in a shared vehicle during the car-sharing period.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-304(2): A car-sharing program may own and maintain as the named insured one or more policies of motor vehicle insurance that provide coverage for:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-304(2)(a): a liability assumed by the car-sharing program under a car-sharing agreement;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-304(2)(b): a liability of the shared vehicle owner;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-304(2)(c): a liability of the shared vehicle driver; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-304(2)(d): damage or loss to a shared vehicle.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-304(3): Nothing in this section requires a car-sharing program to maintain insurance coverage for the car-sharing program's liability under this chapter.


Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-305 Recovery for claim excluded from insurance policy.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
An insurance company that defends or indemnifies a claim against a shared vehicle that is excluded under the terms of the insurance company's policy shall have the right to seek recovery against the motor vehicle insurer of the car-sharing program if the claim is:Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-305(1): made against the shared vehicle owner or shared vehicle driver for a loss or injury that occurs during the car-sharing period; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-305(2): excluded under the terms of the policy of the insurance company that defends or indemnifies the claim.


Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-306 Exemption from liability based on operation of a car-sharing program or on vehicle ownership.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Consistent with 49 U.S.C. Sec. 30106, a car-sharing program and a shared vehicle owner are exempt from vicarious liability under any state or local law that imposes liability solely based on vehicle ownership.

Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-307 Driver license requirement and records.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-307(1): A car-sharing program may not enter into a car-sharing agreement with a driver unless the driver who will operate the shared vehicle:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-307(1)(a): holds a driver license issued under the applicable law of this state that authorizes the driver to operate vehicles of the class of the shared vehicle;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-307(1)(b): is a nonresident who:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-307(1)(b)(i): has a driver license issued by the state or country of the driver's residence that authorizes the driver in that state or country to drive vehicles of the class of the shared vehicle; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-307(1)(b)(ii): is at least the same age as that required of a resident to drive; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-307(1)(c): otherwise is specifically authorized to drive vehicles of the class of the shared vehicle.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-307(2): A car-sharing program shall keep a record of:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-307(2)(a): the name and address of the shared vehicle driver;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-307(2)(b): the number of the driver license of the shared vehicle driver and each other person, if any, who will operate the shared vehicle; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-48a-307(2)(c): the place of issuance of the driver license.


Utah Code Annotated - Title 13 - Chapter 49 - Immigration Consultants Registration Act
**************************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-101 Title.
--------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Immigration Consultants Registration Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-102 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-102(1): "Client" means a person who receives services from or enters into an agreement to receive services from an immigration consultant.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-102(2): "Compensation" means anything of economic value that is paid, loaned, granted, given, donated, or transferred to a person for or in consideration of:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-102(2)(a): services;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-102(2)(b): personal or real property; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-102(2)(c): another thing of value.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-102(3): "Department" means the Department of Commerce.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-102(4): "Division" means the Division of Consumer Protection in the department.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-102(5): "Immigration consultant" means an individual who provides nonlegal assistance or advice on an immigration matter including:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-102(5)(a): completing a document provided by a federal or state agency, but not advising a person as to the person's answers on the document;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-102(5)(b): translating a person's answer to a question posed in a document provided by a federal or state agency;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-102(5)(c): securing for a person supporting documents, such as a birth certificate, that may be necessary to complete a document provided by a federal or state agency;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-102(5)(d): submitting a completed document on a person's behalf and at the person's request to the United States Citizenship and Immigration Services; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-102(5)(e): for valuable consideration, referring a person to a person who could undertake legal representation activities in an immigration matter.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-102(6): "Immigration matter" means a proceeding, filing, or action affecting the immigration or citizenship status of a person that arises under:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-102(6)(a): immigration and naturalization law;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-102(6)(b): executive order or presidential proclamation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-102(6)(c): action of the United States Citizenship and Immigration Services, the United States Department of State, or the United States Department of Labor.


Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-201 Requirement to be registered as an immigration consultant -- Exemptions.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-201(1): (1)(b); 13-49-303(3); (4)
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-201(1)(a): (1)(b) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-201(1)(b): 13-49-303(3); (4) Except for Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-201(1)(b)(i): to practice law in this state; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-201(1)(b)(ii): by federal law to represent an individual before the Board of Immigration Appeals or the United States Citizenship and Immigration Services.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-201(2): An immigration consultant may only offer nonlegal assistance or advice in an immigration matter.


Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-202 Application for registration.
-------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-202(1): 63J-1-504; (1)(e) To register as an immigration consultant an individual shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-202(1)(a): submit an annual application in a form prescribed by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-202(1)(b): 63J-1-504; (1)(e) pay an annual registration fee determined by the department in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-202(1)(c): have good moral character in that the individual has not been convicted of:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-202(1)(c)(i): a felony; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-202(1)(c)(ii): within the last 10 years, a misdemeanor involving theft, fraud, or dishonesty;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-202(1)(d): submit fingerprint cards in a form acceptable to the division at the time the application is filed; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-202(1)(e): consent to a fingerprint background check of the individual by the Utah Bureau of Criminal Identification regarding the application.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-202(2): The division shall register an individual who qualifies under this chapter as an immigration consultant.


Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-203 Requirement to submit to criminal background check.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-203(1): The division shall require an applicant for registration as an immigration consultant to:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-203(1)(a): submit a fingerprint card in a form acceptable to the division; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-203(1)(b): consent to a fingerprint criminal background check by the Utah Bureau of Criminal Identification.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-203(2): Title 53, Chapter 10, Part 2, Bureau of Criminal Identification; (2)(a); 13-49-202(1)(c)

Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-203(2)(b): (2)(a); 13-49-202(1)(c) The information obtained under Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-204 Bonds -- Exemption -- Statements dependent on posting bond.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-204(1): An immigration consultant shall post a cash bond or surety bond:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-204(1)(a): in the amount of $50,000; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-204(1)(b): payable to the division for the benefit of any person damaged by a fraud, misstatement, misrepresentation, unlawful act, omission, or failure to provide services of an immigration consultant, or an agent, representative, or employee of an immigration consultant.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-204(2): A bond required under this section shall be:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-204(2)(a): in a form approved by the division; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-204(2)(b): conditioned upon the faithful compliance of an immigration consultant with this chapter and division rules.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-204(3): An immigration consultant shall keep the bond required under this section in force for one year after the immigration consultant's registration expires or the immigration consultant notifies the division in writing that the immigration consultant has ceased all activities regulated under this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-204(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-204(4)(a): If a surety bond posted by an immigration consultant under this section is canceled due to the immigration consultant's negligence, the division may assess a $300 reinstatement fee.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-204(4)(b): No part of a bond posted by an immigration consultant under this section may be withdrawn:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-204(4)(b)(i): during the one-year period the registration under this chapter is in effect; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-204(4)(b)(ii): while a revocation proceeding is pending against the immigration consultant.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-204(5): (5)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-204(5)(a): A bond posted under this section by an immigration consultant may be forfeited if the immigration consultant's registration under this chapter is revoked.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-204(5)(b): (5)(a) Notwithstanding Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-204(6): An individual may not disseminate by any means a statement indicating that the individual is an immigration consultant, engages in the business of an immigration consultant, or proposes to engage in the business of an immigration consultant, unless the individual has posted a bond under this section that is maintained throughout the period covered by the statement.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-204(7): An immigration consultant may not make or authorize the making of an oral or written reference to the immigration consultant's compliance with the bonding requirements of this section except as provided in this chapter.


Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-301 Requirements for written contract -- Prohibited statements.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-301(1): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-301(1)(a): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act Before an immigration consultant may provide services to a client, the immigration consultant shall provide the client with a written contract.  The contents of the written contract shall comply with this section and rules made by the division in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-301(1)(b): A client may cancel a written contract on or before midnight of the third business day after execution of the written contract, excluding weekends and state and federal holidays.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-301(2): A written contract under this section shall be stated in both English and in the client's native language.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-301(3): (1)(b); (2) A written contract under this section shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-301(3)(a): state the purpose for which the immigration consultant has been hired;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-301(3)(b): state the one or more services to be performed;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-301(3)(c): state the price for a service to be performed;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-301(3)(d): include a statement printed in 10-point boldface type that the immigration consultant is not an attorney and may not perform the legal services that an attorney performs;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-301(3)(e): with regard to a document to be prepared by the immigration consultant:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-301(3)(e)(i): list the document to be prepared;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-301(3)(e)(ii): explain the purpose of the document;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-301(3)(e)(iii): explain the process to be followed in preparing of the document;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-301(3)(e)(iv): explain the action to be taken by the immigration consultant;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-301(3)(e)(v): state the agency or office where each document will be filed; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-301(3)(e)(vi): state the approximate processing times according to current published agency guidelines;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-301(3)(f): include a provision stating that the person may report complaints relating to an immigration consultant to the:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-301(3)(f)(i): division, including a toll-free telephone number and Internet web site; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-301(3)(f)(ii): Office of Immigrant Assistance of the United States Department of Justice, including a toll-free telephone number and Internet website;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-301(3)(g): include a provision stating that complaints concerning the unauthorized practice of law may be reported to the Utah State Bar, including a toll-free telephone number and Internet website; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-301(3)(h): (1)(b); (2) in accordance with Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-301(4): A written contract may not contain a provision relating to the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-301(4)(a): a guarantee or promise, unless the immigration consultant has some basis in fact for making the guarantee or promise; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-301(4)(b): a statement that the immigration consultant can or will obtain a special favor from or has special influence with the United States Citizenship and Immigration Services, or any other governmental agency, employee, or official, that may have a bearing on a client's immigration matter.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-301(5): (4) An immigration consultant may not make a statement described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-301(6): A written contract is void if not written in accordance with this section.


Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-302 Accounting for services -- Receipts.
--------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-302(1): An immigration consultant shall provide a signed receipt to a client for each payment made by that client.  The receipt shall be typed or computer generated on the immigration consultant's letterhead.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-302(2): An immigration consultant shall make a statement of accounting for the services rendered and payments made:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-302(2)(a): in the client's native language;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-302(2)(b): to the client every two months;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-302(2)(c): that is typed or computer generated on the immigration consultant's letterhead;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-302(2)(d): that lists the individual charges and total charges for services; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-302(2)(e): that lists the payments made by the client.


Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-303 Notice to be displayed -- Disclosure to be provided in writing.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-303(1): An immigration consultant shall conspicuously display in the immigration consultant's office a notice that shall be at least 12 by 20 inches with boldface type or print with each character at least one inch in height and width in English and in the native language of the immigration consultant's clientele, that contains the following information:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-303(1)(a): the full name, address, and evidence of compliance with any applicable bonding requirement including the bond number;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-303(1)(b): a statement that the immigration consultant is not an attorney; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-303(1)(c): the name of each immigration consultant employed at each location.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-303(2): (2)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-303(2)(a): Before providing any services, an immigration consultant shall provide a client with a written disclosure in the native language of the client that includes the following:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-303(2)(a)(i): the immigration consultant's name, address, and telephone number;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-303(2)(a)(ii): the immigration consultant's agent for service of process;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-303(2)(a)(iii): evidence of compliance with any applicable bonding requirement, including the bond number; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-303(2)(a)(iv): a list of the services that the immigration consultant provides and the current and total fee for each service.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-303(2)(b): (2)(a) An immigration consultant shall obtain the signature of the client verifying that the client received the written disclosures described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-303(3): (3)(b); (3)(c); (3)(a); (3)(b); (3)(a); (3)(c)

Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-304 Translations -- Prohibited acts.
----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-304(1): For purposes of this section, "literal translation" of a word or phrase from one language means the translation of a word or phrase without regard to the true meaning of the word or phrase in the language that is being translated.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-304(2): An immigration consultant may not, with the intent to mislead, literally translate, from English into another language, words or titles, including, "notary public," "notary," "licensed," "attorney," "lawyer," or any other terms that imply that the immigration consultant is an attorney, in any document, including an advertisement, stationery, letterhead, business card, or other comparable written material describing the immigration consultant.


Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-305 Documents -- Treatment of original documents.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-305(1): An immigration consultant shall deliver to a client a copy of a document completed on behalf of the client.  An immigration consultant shall include on a document delivered to a client the name and address of the immigration consultant.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-305(2): An immigration consultant shall retain a copy of a document of a client for not less than three years from the date of the last service to the client.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-305(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-305(3)(a): An immigration consultant shall return to a client all original documents that the client has provided to the immigration consultant in support of the client's application including an original birth certificate, rental agreement, utility bill, employment document, a registration document issued by the Division of Motor Vehicles, or a passport.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-305(3)(b): An original document that does not need to be submitted to immigration authorities as an original document shall be returned by the immigration consultant immediately after making a copy.


Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-401 Unlawful acts.
----------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-401(1): It is unlawful for an immigration consultant to:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-401(1)(a): make a false or misleading statement to a client while providing services to that client;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-401(1)(b): make a guarantee or promise to a client, unless the guarantee or promise is in writing and the immigration consultant has some basis in fact for making the guarantee or promise;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-401(1)(c): make a statement that the immigration consultant can or will obtain a special favor from or has special influence with the United States Citizenship and Immigration Services, or any other governmental agency, employee, or official, that may have a bearing on a client's immigration matter; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-401(1)(d): charge a client a fee for referral of the client to another person for services that the immigration consultant cannot or will not provide to the client.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-401(2): (1)(d) A sign describing the prohibition described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-402 Violations -- Actions by division.
------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-402(1): The division may make an investigation the division considers necessary to determine whether a person is violating, has violated, or is about to violate this chapter or any rule made or order issued under this chapter.  As part of the investigation, the division may:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-402(1)(a): require a person to file a statement in writing;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-402(1)(b): administer oaths, subpoena witnesses and compel their attendance, take evidence, and examine under oath any person in connection with an investigation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-402(1)(c): require the production of any books, papers, documents, merchandise, or other material relevant to the investigation.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-402(2): A person who violates this chapter is subject to:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-402(2)(a): a cease and desist order; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-402(2)(b): an administrative fine of not less than $1,000 or more than $5,000 for each separate violation.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-402(3): 13-2-8 An administrative fine shall be deposited in the Consumer Protection Education and Training Fund created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-402(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-402(4)(a): A person who intentionally violates this chapter:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-402(4)(a)(i): is guilty of a class A misdemeanor; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-402(4)(a)(ii): may be fined up to $10,000.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-402(4)(b): A person intentionally violates this part if the violation occurs after the division, attorney general, or a district or county attorney notifies the person by certified mail that the person is in violation of this chapter.


Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-403 Action by attorney general or district or county attorney.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-403(1): 13-49-402(2); 13-49-402(4) Upon referral from the division, the attorney general or any district or county attorney may:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-403(1)(a): bring an action for temporary or permanent injunctive or other relief in any court of competent jurisdiction for any violation of this part;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-403(1)(b): 13-49-402(2) bring an action in any court of competent jurisdiction for the collection of penalties authorized under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-403(1)(c): 13-49-402(4) bring an action under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-403(2): A court may, upon entry of final judgment, award restitution when appropriate to any person suffering loss because of a violation of this part if proof of loss is submitted to the satisfaction of the court.


Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-404 Recovery of losses.
---------------------------------------------------
In addition to any other remedies, a person suffering pecuniary loss because of a violation by another person of this chapter may bring an action in any court of competent jurisdiction and may recover:Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-404(1): the greater of $500 or twice the amount of the pecuniary loss; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-49-404(2): court costs and reasonable attorney fees as determined by the court.


Utah Code Annotated - Title 13 - Chapter 50 - Residential Construction Contracts Act
************************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 13-50-101 Title.
--------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-50-101(1): This chapter is known as the "Residential Construction Contracts Act."
Utah Code Annotated § 13-50-101(2): This part is known as "General Provisions."


Utah Code Annotated § 13-50-102 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 13-50-102(1): "Rebate" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-50-102(1)(a): any allowance or discount against charged fees; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-50-102(1)(b): payment of any form of compensation, except for an item of nominal value, to:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-50-102(1)(b)(i): an insured; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-50-102(1)(b)(ii): a person directly or indirectly associated with a residential building.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-50-102(2): "Repair work" means any work done to siding, gutters, a roof system, or a window system to repair damage caused by wind or hail.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-50-102(3): "Residential building" means a single or multiple family dwelling of up to four units.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-50-102(4): "Residential contractor" means a person that, for compensation, other than wages as an employee, contracts or offers to contract to:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-50-102(4)(a): perform repair work on a residential building;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-50-102(4)(b): arrange for, manage, or process repair work on a residential building; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-50-102(4)(c): serve as a representative, agent, or assignee of the owner or possessor of a residential building for purposes of repair work on the residential building.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-50-102(5): "Roof system" includes roof coverings, roof sheathing, roof weatherproofing, roof framing, roof ventilation, and roof insulation.


Utah Code Annotated § 13-50-201 Title.
--------------------------------------
This part is known as "Right to Cancel Certain Residential Construction Contracts."

Utah Code Annotated § 13-50-202 Right to cancel.
------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-50-202(1): A person that enters into a written contract with a residential contractor for the performance of repair work on a residential building may cancel the contract if:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-50-202(1)(a): at the time of the execution of the contract, the residential contractor knew or should have known that the person intended that all or part of the contract would be paid with proceeds of a property and casualty insurance policy;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-50-202(1)(b): the property and casualty insurer denies any part of the person's claim relating to the repair work governed by the contract; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-50-202(1)(c): within five business days after the day on which the person receives written notice from the person's property and casualty insurer that all or part of the person's claim relating to the repair work governed by the contract is denied, the person deposits in the United States mail, or otherwise provides, written notice of cancellation to the physical address provided in the contract.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-50-202(2): (3); (1) Except as provided in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 13-50-202(3): A residential contractor may retain or collect the reasonable value of any repair work described in the contract that was actually performed, if the owner of the residential building expressly instructed the residential contractor to perform the repair work without waiting for the property and casualty insurer to provide notice of whether it accepts or denies coverage of the contract.


Utah Code Annotated § 13-50-203 Required provisions.
----------------------------------------------------
A written contract between a person and a residential contractor for the performance of repair work on a residential building shall:Utah Code Annotated § 13-50-203(1): 13-50-202; 13-50-202 include a notice of the person's right to cancel the contract, as described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 13-50-203(2): state the mailing address where the residential contractor receives written notice; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-50-203(3): include a detachable copy of a notice of cancellation that is in substantially the following form:

"YOU ARE AGREEING TO GIVE UP CERTAIN RIGHTS YOU HAVE UNDER YOUR INSURANCE POLICY. Utah Code Annotated § 13-50-302 Residential contractor, prohibited acts.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
A residential contractor may not rebate or offer to rebate any portion of an insurance deductible as an inducement to the sale of a good or service.

Utah Code Annotated § 13-50-304 Violation of part.
--------------------------------------------------
A post-loss assignment of rights or benefits entered into with a residential contractor is void if the residential contractor violates a provision of this part.

Utah Code Annotated - Title 13 - Chapter 51 - Transportation Network Company Registration Act
*********************************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-101 Title.
--------------------------------------
This chapter is known as "Transportation Network Company Registration Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-102 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-102(1): "Division" means the Division of Consumer Protection within the Department of Commerce.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-102(2): "Prearranged ride" means a period of time that:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-102(2)(a): begins when the transportation network driver has accepted a passenger's request for a ride through the transportation network company's software application; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-102(2)(b): ends when the passenger exits the transportation network driver's vehicle.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-102(3): "Software application" means an Internet-connected software platform, including a mobile application, that a transportation network company uses to:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-102(3)(a): connect a transportation network driver to a passenger; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-102(3)(b): process passenger requests.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-102(4): 53-3-102; 72-9-102; 41-26-102.1 "Transportation network company" means an entity that:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-102(4)(a): uses a software application to connect a passenger to a transportation network driver providing transportation network services;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-102(4)(b): 53-3-102; 72-9-102 is not:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-102(4)(b)(i): 53-3-102 a taxicab, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-102(4)(b)(ii): 72-9-102 a motor carrier, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-102(4)(c): 41-26-102.1 except in certain cases involving a motor vehicle with a level four or five automated driving system, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-102(5): 41-26-102.1 "Transportation network driver" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-102(5)(a): an individual who:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-102(5)(a)(i): pays a fee to a transportation network company, and, in exchange, receives a connection to a potential passenger from the transportation network company;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-102(5)(a)(ii): operates a motor vehicle that:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-102(5)(a)(ii)(A): the individual owns, leases, or is authorized to use; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-102(5)(a)(ii)(B): the individual uses to provide transportation network services; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-102(5)(a)(iii): receives, in exchange for providing a passenger a ride, compensation that exceeds the individual's cost to provide the ride; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-102(5)(b): 41-26-102.1 a level four or five automated driving system, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-102(6): "Transportation network services" means, for a transportation network driver providing services through a transportation network company:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-102(6)(a): providing a prearranged ride; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-102(6)(b): being engaged in a waiting period.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-102(7): "Waiting period" means a period of time when:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-102(7)(a): a transportation network driver is logged into a transportation network company's software application; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-102(7)(b): the transportation network driver is not engaged in a prearranged ride.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-103(1): Title 72, Chapter 9, Motor Carrier Safety Act; Title 59, Chapter 12, Sales and Use Tax Act; Title 53, Chapter 3, Uniform Driver License Act A transportation network company or a transportation network driver is not subject to the requirements applicable to:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-103(1)(a): Title 72, Chapter 9, Motor Carrier Safety Act a motor carrier, under
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-103(1)(b): Title 59, Chapter 12, Sales and Use Tax Act a common carrier, under
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-103(1)(c): Title 53, Chapter 3, Uniform Driver License Act a taxicab, under
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-103(2): 41-26-102.1 A transportation network driver is:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-103(2)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-103(2)(a)(i): an independent contractor of a transportation network company; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-103(2)(a)(ii): not an employee of a transportation network company; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-103(2)(b): 41-26-102.1 for a motor vehicle with a level four or five automated driving system as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-103(2)(b)(i): at the direction of, on behalf of, or as an agent of a transportation network company; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-103(2)(b)(ii): at the direction of, on behalf of, or as an agent of a third party pursuant to an agreement between the third party and a transportation network company, operated on behalf of and as an agent of the transportation network company.


Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-104 Licensure -- Division audits -- Fines.
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-104(1): (2) A person may not operate a transportation network company without registering with the division under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-104(2): 13-51-102; 63J-1-504 The division shall register a person to operate a transportation network company if:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-104(2)(a): 13-51-102; 63J-1-504 the person:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-104(2)(a)(i): 13-51-102 demonstrates to the division that the person meets the definition of a transportation network company under Section

Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-105 Operating requirements.
-------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-105(1): A transportation network company shall maintain an agent for service of process in the state and shall notify the division of the name and address of the agent.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-105(2): A transportation network company may collect, on behalf of a transportation network driver, a fare for a prearranged ride if the transportation network company:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-105(2)(a): posts the method for calculating the fare on the transportation network company's software application;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-105(2)(b): provides a passenger the rate used to calculate the fare for a prearranged ride; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-105(2)(c): allows a passenger the option to obtain an estimated fare for a prearranged ride before the passenger enters a transportation network driver's vehicle.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-105(3): For each prearranged ride, a transportation network company shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-105(3)(a): before a passenger enters a transportation network driver's vehicle, display on the transportation network company's software application a picture of the transportation network driver;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-105(3)(b): shortly after the prearranged ride is complete, transmit an electronic receipt to the passenger that lists:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-105(3)(b)(i): the prearranged ride's origin and destination;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-105(3)(b)(ii): the prearranged ride's total time and distance; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-105(3)(b)(iii): an itemization of the total fare the passenger paid, if any; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-105(3)(c): allow a passenger to notify a transportation network driver if a passenger has skis, a snowboard, other oversize luggage, or child restraint device.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-105(4): A transportation network driver may not, while providing transportation network services:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-105(4)(a): provide a ride to an individual who requests the ride by a means other than a transportation network company's software application;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-105(4)(b): solicit or accept cash payments from a passenger; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-105(4)(c): accept any means of payment other than payment through a transportation network company's software application.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-105(5): A transportation network company shall maintain a record of:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-105(5)(a): all trips, for a minimum of five years after the day on which the trip occurred; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-105(5)(b): all information in a transportation network company's possession regarding a transportation network driver, for a minimum of five years after the day on which the transportation network driver last provided transportation network services using the transportation network company's software application.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-105(6): A transportation network company shall adopt a policy that prohibits unlawful discrimination with respect to a passenger and shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-105(6)(a): provide a copy of the policy to each transportation network driver; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-105(6)(b): post the policy on the transportation network company's website.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-105(7): 
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-105(7)(a): A transportation network driver shall accommodate:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-105(7)(a)(i): a service animal; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-105(7)(a)(ii): an individual with a physical disability.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-105(7)(b): A transportation network driver or transportation network company may not impose an additional charge to provide the accommodations described in Subsections (7)(a) and (8).
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-105(8): A transportation network company shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-105(8)(a): allow a passenger to request a prearranged ride in a wheelchair-accessible vehicle; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-105(8)(b): if a wheelchair-accessible vehicle is not available to a passenger who requests a wheelchair-accessible vehicle under Subsection (8)(a), direct the passenger to a transportation service that provides wheelchair-accessible service, if available.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-105(9): A transportation network company shall disclose to a transportation network driver:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-105(9)(a): a description of the insurance coverage the transportation network company provides the transportation network driver while the transportation network driver is providing transportation network services, including the insurance coverage's liability limit;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-105(9)(b): that the transportation network company's personal automobile insurance policy may not provide coverage to the transportation network driver during a waiting period or a prearranged ride;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-105(9)(c): that if the vehicle the transportation network driver uses to provide transportation network services has a lien against the vehicle, the transportation network driver is required to notify the lienholder that the transportation network driver is using the vehicle to provide transportation network services; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-105(9)(d): that using a vehicle with a lien against the vehicle to provide transportation network services may violate the transportation network driver's contract with the lienholder.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-105(10): A transportation network company and the transportation network company's insurer shall, for an incident that occurs while a transportation network driver is providing transportation network services:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-105(10)(a): cooperate with a liability insurer that insures the vehicle the transportation network driver uses to provide the transportation network services;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-105(10)(b): provide, to the liability insurer, the precise date and time that an incident occurred, including the precise time when a driver logged in or out of the transportation network company's software application; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-105(10)(c): provide the information described in Subsection (10)(b) to a liability insurer no later than 10 business days after the day on which the liability insurer requests the information from the transportation network company.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-105(11): If a transportation network company's insurer insures a vehicle with a lien against the vehicle, and the transportation network company's insurer covers a claim regarding the vehicle under comprehensive or collision coverage, the transportation network company shall direct the transportation network company's insurer to issue the payment for the claim:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-105(11)(a): directly to the person that is repairing the vehicle; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-105(11)(b): jointly to the owner of the vehicle and the primary lienholder.


Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-106 Transportation network driver drug or alcohol use policy.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-106(1): A transportation network company shall implement a policy that:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-106(1)(a): provides that a transportation network driver may not use a drug or alcohol or be under the influence of a drug or alcohol while providing transportation network services;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-106(1)(b): is posted on the transportation network company's website or software application; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-106(1)(c): provides procedures for a passenger to report to the transportation network company a transportation network driver who the passenger suspects violated the policy.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-106(2): (1)(c) If a transportation network company receives a complaint about a transportation network driver under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-106(2)(a): suspend the transportation network company driver; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-106(2)(b): conduct an investigation into the transportation network company driver and the conduct alleged in the complaint.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-106(3): A transportation network company shall maintain records related to a complaint or investigation under this section for a minimum of two years after the day on which the transportation network company receives the complaint.


Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-107 Driver requirements.
----------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-107(1): Before a transportation network company allows an individual to use the transportation network company's software application as a transportation network driver, the transportation network company shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-107(1)(a): require the individual to submit to the transportation network company:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-107(1)(a)(i): the individual's name, address, and age;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-107(1)(a)(ii): a copy of the individual's driver license, including the driver license number; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-107(1)(a)(iii): proof that the vehicle that the individual will use to provide transportation network services is registered with the Division of Motor Vehicles;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-107(1)(b): require the individual to consent to a criminal background check of the individual by the transportation network company or the transportation network company's designee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-107(1)(c): obtain and review a report that lists the individual's driving history.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-107(2): A transportation company may not allow an individual to provide transportation network services as a transportation network driver if the individual:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-107(2)(a): has committed more than three moving violations in the three years before the day on which the individual applies to become a transportation network driver;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-107(2)(b): has been convicted, in the seven years before the day on which the individual applies to become a transportation network driver, of:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-107(2)(b)(i): driving under the influence of alcohol or drugs;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-107(2)(b)(ii): fraud;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-107(2)(b)(iii): a sexual offense;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-107(2)(b)(iv): a felony involving a motor vehicle;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-107(2)(b)(v): a crime involving property damage;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-107(2)(b)(vi): a crime involving theft;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-107(2)(b)(vii): a crime of violence; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-107(2)(b)(viii): an act of terror;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-107(2)(c): is required to register as a sex offender, kidnap offender, or child abuse offender in accordance with Title 77, Chapter 41, Sex, Kidnap, and Child Abuse Offender Registry;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-107(2)(d): does not have a valid Utah driver license; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-107(2)(e): is not at least 18 years old.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-107(3): 41-6a-1601; 41-6a-1642; 41-6a-1601; 41-6a-1601

Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-201 Transportation Network Vehicle Recovery Fund -- Creation -- Report to the Legislature.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-201(1): (2) As used in this part, "fund" means the Transportation Network Vehicle Recovery Fund created in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-201(2): There is created an expendable special revenue fund called the "Transportation Network Vehicle Recovery Fund."

Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-201(3)(a): money deposited in the fund before July 1, 2018; and

Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-203 Payment of a claim from the fund.
-----------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-203(1): A person that holds a lien on a vehicle used by a transportation network driver to provide transportation network services may submit a claim to the division for payment from the fund for physical damage to the vehicle.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-203(2): (1); 41-1a-601; (2)(c) The division shall pay a claim for payment from the fund to a person that holds a lien on a vehicle described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-203(2)(a): the physical damage to the vehicle occurred during a waiting period or a prearranged ride;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-203(2)(b): 41-1a-601 the lien complies with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-203(2)(c): the person required the transportation network driver, by contract, to maintain insurance coverage for physical damage to the vehicle;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-203(2)(d): (2)(c) the insurance coverage described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-203(2)(d)(i): names the person as the loss payee;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-203(2)(d)(ii): was in effect at the time the physical damage occurred; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-203(2)(d)(iii): denied coverage to the person as the loss payee on the sole basis that the transportation network driver used the vehicle to provide transportation network services in the state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-203(2)(e): the division determines, no earlier than 10 days after the day on which the person makes the claim, that:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-203(2)(e)(i): no other insurance is available from the relevant transportation network company; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-203(2)(e)(ii): the fund has enough money to cover the cost of the claim.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-203(3): (2) If the division grants a claim to a person for a lien on a transportation network driver's vehicle under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-203(3)(a): the cost to repair the vehicle;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-203(3)(b): the actual cash value of the vehicle less any salvage costs; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-203(3)(c): the amount of money in the fund.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-51-203(4): The division may not accept or pay a claim under this section after the balance of the fund is zero.
