Utah Code Annotated - Title 13 - Chapter 52 - Residential Solar Energy Disclosure Act
*************************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-101 Title.
--------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Residential Solar Energy Disclosure Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-102 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-102(1): "Customer" means a person who, for primarily personal, family, or household purposes:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-102(1)(a): purchases a residential solar energy system under a system purchase agreement;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-102(1)(b): leases a residential solar energy system under a system lease agreement; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-102(1)(c): purchases electricity under a power purchase agreement.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-102(2): 13-2-1 "Division" means the Division of Consumer Protection, established in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-102(3): "Power purchase agreement" means an agreement:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-102(3)(a): between a customer and a solar retailer;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-102(3)(b): for the customer's purchase of electricity generated by a residential solar energy system owned by the solar retailer; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-102(3)(c): that provides for the customer to make payments over a term of at least five years.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-102(4): "Residential solar energy system":
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-102(4)(a): means a solar energy system that:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-102(4)(a)(i): is installed in the state;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-102(4)(a)(ii): generates electricity primarily for on-site consumption for personal, family, or household purposes;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-102(4)(a)(iii): is situated on no more than four units of residential real property; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-102(4)(a)(iv): has an electricity delivery capacity that exceeds one kilowatt; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-102(4)(b): does not include a generator that:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-102(4)(b)(i): produces electricity; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-102(4)(b)(ii): is intended for occasional use.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-102(5): "Solar agreement" means a system purchase agreement, a system lease agreement, or a power purchase agreement.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-102(6): "Solar energy system" means a system or configuration of solar energy devices that collects and uses solar energy to generate electricity.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-102(7): "Solar retailer" means a person who:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-102(7)(a): sells or proposes to sell a residential solar energy system to a customer under a system purchase agreement;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-102(7)(b): owns the residential solar energy system that is the subject of a system lease agreement or proposed system lease agreement; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-102(7)(c): sells or proposes to sell electricity to a customer under a power purchase agreement.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-102(8): "System lease agreement" means an agreement:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-102(8)(a): under which a customer leases a residential solar energy system from a solar retailer; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-102(8)(b): that provides for the customer to make payments over a term of at least five years for the lease of the residential solar energy system.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-102(9): "System purchase agreement" means an agreement under which a customer purchases a residential solar energy system from a solar retailer.


Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-103 Applicability of chapter.
---------------------------------------------------------
This chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-103(1): applies to each solar agreement entered into on or after September 3, 2018, including a solar agreement that accompanies the transfer of ownership or lease of real property; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-103(2): does not apply to:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-103(2)(a): the transfer of title or rental of real property on which a residential solar energy system is or is expected to be located, if the presence of the residential solar energy system is incidental to the transfer of title or rental;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-103(2)(b): a lender, governmental entity, or other third party that enters into an agreement with a customer to finance a residential solar energy system but is not a party to a system purchase agreement, power purchase agreement, or lease agreement;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-103(2)(c): a sale or lease of, or the purchase of electricity from, a solar energy system that is not a residential solar energy system; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-103(2)(d): the lease of a residential solar energy system or the purchase of power from a residential solar energy system under an agreement providing for payments over a term of less than five years.


Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-201 Disclosure statement required.
--------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-201(1): 13-52-202; 13-52-203; 13-52-204; 13-52-205 At the time of entering a solar agreement, a solar retailer shall provide to a potential customer a separate, written disclosure statement as provided in this section and, as applicable, Sections
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-201(2): 13-52-202; 13-52-203; 13-52-204; 13-52-205 A disclosure statement under Subsection (1) shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-201(2)(a): be in paper form;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-201(2)(b): be in at least 12-point font;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-201(2)(c): contain:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-201(2)(c)(i): the name, address, telephone number, and any email address of the potential customer;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-201(2)(c)(ii): the name, address, telephone number, and email address of the solar retailer; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-201(2)(c)(iii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-201(2)(c)(iii)(A): the name, address, telephone number, email address, and state contractor license number of the person who is expected to install the system that is the subject of the solar agreement; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-201(2)(c)(iii)(B): if the solar retailer selected the person who is expected to provide operations or maintenance support to the potential customer or introduced that person to the potential customer, the name, address, telephone number, email address, and state contractor license of the operations or maintenance support person; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-201(2)(d): 13-52-202; 13-52-203; 13-52-204; 13-52-205 include applicable information and disclosures as provided in Sections


Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-202 Contents of disclosure statement for any solar agreement.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
If a solar retailer is proposing to enter any solar agreement with a potential customer, the disclosure statement required in SubsectionUtah Code Annotated § 13-52-202(1): a statement indicating that operations or maintenance services are not included as part of the solar agreement, if those services are not included as part of the solar agreement;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-202(2): if the solar retailer provides any written estimate of the savings the potential customer is projected to realize from the system:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-202(2)(a): 
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-202(2)(a)(i): the estimated projected savings over the life of the solar agreement; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-202(2)(a)(ii): at the discretion of the solar retailer, the estimated projected savings over any longer period not to exceed the anticipated useful life of the system;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-202(2)(b): any material assumptions used to calculate estimated projected savings and the source of those assumptions, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-202(2)(b)(i): if an annual electricity rate increase is assumed, the rate of the increase and the solar retailer's basis for the assumption of the rate increase;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-202(2)(b)(ii): the potential customer's eligibility for or receipt of tax credits or other governmental or utility incentives;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-202(2)(b)(iii): system production data, including production degradation;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-202(2)(b)(iv): the system's eligibility for interconnection under any net metering or similar program;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-202(2)(b)(v): electrical usage and the system's designed offset of the electrical usage;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-202(2)(b)(vi): historical utility costs paid by the potential customer;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-202(2)(b)(vii): any rate escalation affecting a payment between the potential customer and the solar retailer; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-202(2)(b)(viii): the costs associated with replacing equipment making up part of the system or, if those costs are not assumed, a statement indicating that those costs are not assumed; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-202(2)(c): two separate statements in capital letters in close proximity to any written estimate of projected savings, with substantially the following form and content:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-202(2)(c)(i): "THIS IS AN ESTIMATE. UTILITY RATES MAY GO UP OR DOWN AND ACTUAL SAVINGS, IF ANY, MAY VARY. HISTORICAL DATA ARE NOT NECESSARILY REPRESENTATIVE OF FUTURE RESULTS. FOR FURTHER INFORMATION REGARDING RATES, CONTACT YOUR LOCAL UTILITY OR THE STATE PUBLIC SERVICE COMMISSION."; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-202(2)(c)(ii): "TAX AND OTHER FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL INCENTIVES VARY AS TO REFUNDABILITY AND ARE SUBJECT TO CHANGE OR TERMINATION BY LEGISLATIVE OR REGULATORY ACTION, WHICH MAY IMPACT SAVINGS ESTIMATES. CONSULT A TAX PROFESSIONAL FOR MORE INFORMATION.";
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-202(3): a notice with substantially the following form and content: "Legislative or regulatory action may affect or eliminate your ability to sell or get credit for any excess power generated by the system, and may affect the price or value of that power.";
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-202(4): 13-52-207 a notice describing any right a customer has under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-202(5): a statement describing the system and indicating the system design assumptions, including the make and model of the solar panels and inverters, system size, positioning of the panels on the customer's property, estimated first-year energy production, and estimated annual energy production degradation, including the overall percentage degradation over the term of the solar agreement or, at the solar retailer's option, over the estimated useful life of the system;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-202(6): a description of any warranty, representation, or guarantee of energy production of the system;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-202(7): the approximate start and completion dates for the installation of the system;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-202(8): a statement that the solar retailer may not begin installation of the system until at least four business days after the day on which the solar retailer and customer enter into a contract;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-202(9): a statement indicating whether any warranty or maintenance obligations related to the system may be transferred by the solar retailer to a third party and, if so, a statement with substantially the following form and content: "The maintenance and repair obligations under your contract may be assigned or transferred without your consent to a third party who will be bound to all the terms of the contract. If a transfer occurs, you will be notified of any change to the address, email address, or phone number to use for questions or payments or to request system maintenance or repair.";
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-202(10): if the solar retailer will not obtain customer approval to connect the system to the customer's utility, a statement to that effect and a description of what the customer must do to interconnect the system to the utility;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-202(11): a description of any roof penetration warranty or other warranty that the solar retailer provides the customer or a statement, in bold capital letters, that the solar retailer does not provide any warranty;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-202(12): a statement indicating whether the solar retailer will make a fixture filing or other notice in the county real property records covering the system, including a Notice of Independently Owned Solar Energy System, and any fees or other costs associated with the filing that may be charged to the customer;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-202(13): a statement in capital letters with substantially the following form and content: "NO EMPLOYEE OR REPRESENTATIVE OF [name of solar retailer] IS AUTHORIZED TO MAKE ANY PROMISE TO YOU THAT IS NOT CONTAINED IN THIS DISCLOSURE STATEMENT CONCERNING COST SAVINGS, TAX BENEFITS, OR GOVERNMENT OR UTILITY INCENTIVES. YOU SHOULD NOT RELY UPON ANY PROMISE OR ESTIMATE THAT IS NOT INCLUDED IN THIS DISCLOSURE STATEMENT.";
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-202(14): a statement in capital letters with substantially the following form and content: "[name of solar retailer] IS NOT AFFILIATED WITH ANY UTILITY COMPANY OR GOVERNMENT AGENCY. NO EMPLOYEE OR REPRESENTATIVE OF [name of solar retailer] IS AUTHORIZED TO CLAIM AFFILIATION WITH A UTILITY COMPANY OR GOVERNMENT AGENCY."; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-202(15): any additional information, statement, or disclosure the solar retailer considers appropriate, as long as the additional information, statement, or disclosure does not have the purpose or effect of obscuring the disclosures required under this part.


Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-203 Contents of disclosure statement for system purchase agreement.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
If a solar retailer is proposing to enter a system purchase agreement with a potential customer, the disclosure statement required in SubsectionUtah Code Annotated § 13-52-203(1): a statement with substantially the following form and content: "You are entering an agreement to purchase an energy generation system. You will own the system installed on your property. You may be entitled to federal tax credits because of the purchase. You should consult your tax advisor.";
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-203(2): the price quoted to the potential customer for a cash purchase of the system;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-203(3): (3)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-203(3)(a): the schedule of required and anticipated payments from the customer to the solar retailer and third parties over the term of the system purchase agreement, including application fees, up-front charges, down payment, scheduled payments under the system purchase agreement, payments at the end of the term of the system purchase agreement, payments for any operations or maintenance contract offered by or through the solar retailer in connection with the system purchase agreement, and payments for replacement of system components likely to require replacement before the end of the useful life of the system as a whole; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-203(3)(b): (3)(a) the total of all payments referred to in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-203(4): (3) a statement indicating that the cost of insuring the system is not included within the schedule of payments under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-203(5): a statement, if applicable, with substantially the following form and content: "You are responsible for obtaining insurance coverage for any loss or damage to the system. You should consult an insurance professional to understand how to protect against the risk of loss or damage to the system. You should also consult your home insurer about the potential impact of installing a system."; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-203(6): information about whether the system may be transferred to a purchaser of the home or real property where the system is located and any conditions for a transfer.


Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-204 Contents of disclosure statement for system lease agreement.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
If a solar retailer is proposing to enter a system lease agreement with a potential customer, the disclosure statement required in SubsectionUtah Code Annotated § 13-52-204(1): a statement with substantially the following form and content: "You are entering an agreement to lease an energy generation system. You will lease (not own) the system installed on your property. You will not be entitled to any federal tax credit associated with the lease.";
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-204(2): information about whether the system lease agreement may be transferred to a purchaser of the home or real property where the system is located and, if so, any conditions for a transfer;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-204(3): if the solar retailer will not obtain insurance against damage or loss to the system, a statement to that effect and a description of the consequences to the customer if there is damage or loss to the system; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-204(4): information about what will happen to the system at the end of the term of the system lease agreement.


Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-205 Contents of disclosure statement for power purchase agreement.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
If a solar retailer is proposing to enter a power purchase agreement with a potential customer, the disclosure statement required in SubsectionUtah Code Annotated § 13-52-205(1): a statement with substantially the following form and content: "You are entering an agreement to purchase power from an energy generation system. You will not own the system installed on your property. You will not be entitled to any federal tax credit associated with the purchase.";
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-205(2): information about whether the power purchase agreement may be transferred to a purchaser of the home or real property where the system is located and, if so, any conditions for a transfer;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-205(3): if the solar retailer will not obtain insurance against damage or loss to the system, a statement to that effect and a description of the consequences to the customer if there is damage or loss to the system; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-205(4): information about what will happen to the system at the end of the term of the power purchase agreement.

Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-207 Customer ability to cancel solar agreement.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-207(1): A solar retailer shall provide to the customer a copy of the signed solar agreement, including any disclosures required under this chapter:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-207(1)(a): in electronic and in paper form, unless the customer declines the paper copy in writing; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-207(1)(b): if the solar retailer marketed services for residential solar energy systems to the customer in a language other than English, in that language.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-207(2): A solar agreement is not enforceable against the customer unless the requirements in Subsection (1) are met.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-207(3): A solar retailer may not begin installation of any solar equipment until four business days after the day on which the solar retailer provides the customer the solar agreement described in Subsection (1).
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-207(4): 13-11-4; 13-26-5(2)(a) If a customer cancels a solar agreement under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-207(4)(a): return any check signed by the customer as payment under the terms of the solar agreement; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-207(4)(b): refund any money provided by the customer under the terms of the solar agreement.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-207(5): A solar agreement described in Subsection (1) shall clearly:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-207(5)(a): state the customer's right to cancel the solar agreement under this section; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-207(5)(b): provide an email address and a mailing address where the customer can send the solar retailer a notice of cancellation of the solar agreement.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-207(6): 13-11-4; 13-26-5 Subsection (1)(a) only applies to sales where the customer has a right to cancel the purchase as described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-301 Division enforcement authority -- Administrative fine.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-301(1): Subject to Subsection (2), the division may enforce the provisions of this chapter by:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-301(1)(a): conducting an investigation into an alleged violation of this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-301(1)(b): issuing a cease and desist order against a further violation of this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-301(1)(c): imposing an administrative fine of up to $2,500 for each violation of this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-301(1)(d): the division may bring an action in a court of competent jurisdiction to enforce a provision of this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-301(2): In a court action by the division to enforce a provision of this chapter, the court may:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-301(2)(a): declare that an act or practice violates a provision of this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-301(2)(b): issue an injunction for a violation of this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-301(2)(c): order disgorgement of any money received in violation of this chapter;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-301(2)(d): order payment of disgorged money to an injured purchaser or consumer;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-301(2)(e): impose a fine of up to $2,500 for each violation of this chapter; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-301(2)(f): award any other relief that the court deems reasonable and necessary.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-301(3): 13-2-8 The division shall, in its discretion:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-301(3)(a): 13-2-8 deposit an administrative fine collected under Subsection (1)(c) in the Consumer Protection Education and Training Fund created in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-301(3)(b): distribute an administrative fine collected under Subsection (1)(c) to a customer adversely affected by the solar retailer's failure or violation resulting in a fine under Subsection (1)(c), if the division has conducted an administrative proceeding resulting in a determination of the appropriateness and amount of any distribution to a customer.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-301(4): Nothing in this chapter may be construed to affect:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-301(4)(a): a remedy a customer has independent of this chapter; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-52-301(4)(b): the division's ability or authority to enforce any other law or regulation.


Utah Code Annotated - Title 13 - Chapter 53 - Residential, Vocational and Life Skills Program Act
*************************************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-101 Title.
--------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Residential, Vocational and Life Skills Program Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-102 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-102(1): "Division" means the Division of Consumer Protection.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-102(2): 26B-2-101 "Human services program" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-102(3): "Participant" means an individual who:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-102(3)(a): resides at a residential, vocational and life skills program facility;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-102(3)(b): receives from the residential, vocational and life skills program:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-102(3)(b)(i): vocational training; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-102(3)(b)(ii): life skills training; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-102(3)(c): does not receive monetary compensation from the residential, vocational and life skills program.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-102(4): 13-34-101 "Postsecondary school" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-102(5): 16-6a-102 "Residential, vocational and life skills program" means a program that:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-102(5)(a): 16-6a-102 is operated by a nonprofit corporation, as defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-102(5)(b): does not accept local, state, or federal government funding, government grant money, or any other form of government assistance to operate or provide services or training;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-102(5)(c): operates on a mutually voluntary basis with each participant;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-102(5)(d): houses at a program facility in this state participants who are unrelated to an owner or a manager of the program facility without charging money for lodging, food, clothing, or training;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-102(5)(e): may house transitional graduates for a fee;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-102(5)(f): provides vocational training to participants;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-102(5)(g): provides life skills training to participants;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-102(5)(h): maintains a director or senior staff member at a program facility at all times when the facility is in use;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-102(5)(i): does not provide mental health services;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-102(5)(j): does not provide substance use disorder treatment;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-102(5)(k): does not accept payment from an insurance provider for a participant;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-102(5)(l): does not award a degree, diploma, or other educational credential commensurate with a degree or diploma;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-102(5)(m): does not hold itself out as a human services program; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-102(5)(n): does not hold itself out as a postsecondary school.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-102(6): "Transitional graduate" means an individual who:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-102(6)(a): graduated from a residential, vocational and life skills program;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-102(6)(b): continues to reside at the residential, vocational and life skills program facility; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-102(6)(c): is employed by an entity not directly affiliated with the residential, vocational and life skills program.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-102(7): "Vocational training entity" is a commercial entity where a participant receives vocational training.


Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-103 Registration of a residential, vocational and life skills program.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-103(1): An owner or a manager of a residential, vocational and life skills program shall annually register the residential, vocational and life skills program with the division.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-103(2): 13-22-2; 13-53-108(1); 13-53-106; 13-53-102(5) An application for registration shall be on a form approved by the division and shall require:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-103(2)(a): the name, address, telephone number, email address, website, and facsimile number, if any, of the nonprofit corporation operating the residential, vocational and life skills program;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-103(2)(b): the name and address of the registered agent of the corporation operating the residential, vocational and life skills program;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-103(2)(c): the name, address, telephone number, email address, website, and facsimile number, if any, of the residential, vocational and life skills program;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-103(2)(d): the name and address of any entity that controls, is controlled by, or is affiliated with the residential, vocational and life skills program;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-103(2)(e): the name and residential address of any officer, director, manager, or administrator of the residential, vocational and life skills program;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-103(2)(f): the name, address, telephone number, email address, website, and facsimile number, if any, of any vocational training entity affiliated with the residential, vocational and life skills program;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-103(2)(g): a disclosure indicating whether any officer, director, or administrator of the residential, vocational and life skills program has been the subject of an administrative action by the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-103(2)(h): a disclosure indicating whether any officer, director, or administrator of the residential, vocational and life skills program has been convicted of a felony or a crime of moral turpitude within the previous 10 years;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-103(2)(i): 13-22-2 if the organization is a charitable organization, as defined by Section
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-103(2)(j): 13-53-108(1) financial information described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-103(2)(k): proof of a commercial general liability and umbrella insurance policy providing at least a $1,000,000 per occurrence limit of liability;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-103(2)(l): 13-53-106 a copy of the disclosure required under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-103(2)(m): 13-53-102(5) evidence that the applicant meets the description of a residential, vocational and life skills program under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-103(2)(n): additional information that the division requires, as provided in administrative rule.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-103(3): A residential, vocational and life skills program is registered on the day that the division issues the registration.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-103(4): The division's issuance of a registration for a residential, vocational and life skills program does not constitute the state's or the division's endorsement or approval of the residential, vocational and life skills program.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-103(5): An applicant for the registration of a residential, vocational and life skills program shall file a separate application and pay a separate application fee for each residential, vocational and life skills program location.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-103(6): Title 63G, Chapter 3, Utah Administrative Rulemaking Act The division may make rules in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-103(7): 63J-1-504 The division may set fees in accordance with Section

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-104(1): Chapter 2, Division of Consumer Protection; Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act; 13-53-102(5); 13-53-103(2)(e); 13-53-103(2)(e) In accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-104(1)(a): 13-53-102(5) the entity holding the registration fails to meet the description of a residential, vocational and life skills program under Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-104(1)(c): the registration application or any supplemental information required by the division is incomplete, false, misleading, or filed in an untimely manner;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-104(1)(d): 13-53-103(2)(e) the residential, vocational and life skills program or an individual described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-104(1)(e): 13-53-103(2)(e)
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-104(1)(e)(i): 13-53-103(2)(e) an individual described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-104(1)(e)(ii): the residential, vocational and life skills program does not have adequate controls to minimize associated risks to the participants of the residential, vocational and life skills program and to the public; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-104(1)(f): the residential, vocational and life skills program fails to pay an administrative fine that the division lawfully imposes on the residential, vocational and life skills program.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-104(2): The division may place reasonable limits upon a residential, vocational and life skills program's operations, if:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-104(2)(a): the division has reasonable concerns about the residential, vocational and life skills program's ability to comply with this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-104(2)(b): the limitation is reasonably calculated to protect the interests of the public or the participants of the residential, vocational and life skills program.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-104(3): When the demands of public safety permit, the division shall allow a residential, vocational and life skills program a reasonable amount of time to remedy a violation under this chapter before the division suspends or revokes a registration.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-104(4): 13-53-103(2)(e) The division may require an individual described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-105 Prohibited acts.
------------------------------------------------
A residential, vocational and life skills program may not:Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-105(1): 13-53-103 operate without a registration issued under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-105(2): utilize any behavioral intervention that is not peer-led or that uses the services of any professional or any person purporting to be a professional;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-105(3): 13-53-106 accept a participant before providing to the participant the disclosure described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-105(4): use physical force or permit the use of physical force.


Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-106 Disclosure to participants.
-----------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-106(1): Before accepting a participant, a residential, vocational and life skills program shall provide to the prospective participant a written disclosure.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-106(2): The written disclosure shall include:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-106(2)(a): a statement that the program is a registered residential, vocational and life skills program, but that the residential, vocational and life skills program is not endorsed by the state or the division;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-106(2)(b): a statement that the prospective participant's continuation in the program is voluntary and that a participant may leave at any time;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-106(2)(c): the conditions under which a participant is removed from the residential, vocational and life skills program or required to leave a program facility;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-106(2)(d): a statement that the residential, vocational and life skills program will contact Adult Probation and Parole, if required by law; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-106(2)(e): a description of:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-106(2)(e)(i): the lodging, food, clothing, and other resources that are available to a participant;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-106(2)(e)(ii): the nature and scope of the residential, vocational and life skills program, including any activities or work that a participant is required to perform;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-106(2)(e)(iii): the scope and substance of peer-led activities;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-106(2)(e)(iv): the types of vocational training available to a participant, including the limitations on availability;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-106(2)(e)(v): the nature and extent of possible exposure to profanity, accusation, confrontation, nonphysical threats, or nonphysical corrective interaction;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-106(2)(e)(vi): the terms of any prohibition from contact with a participant's family, friends, or associates; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-106(2)(e)(vii): any crimes committed within the previous two years at the residential, vocational and life skills program facility or at a vocational training entity affiliated with the residential, vocational and life skills program.


Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-107 Participant screening.
------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-107(1): A residential, vocational and life skills program shall interview and screen all prospective participants for medical prescriptions, physical and mental health history, and recent alcohol or drug use.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-107(2): Unless an individual obtains a medical clearance from a physician or physician assistant, a residential, vocational and life skills program may not have as a participant an individual who:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-107(2)(a): has a recent diagnosis of a mental, social, psychiatric, or psychological illness; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-107(2)(b): has an active prescription for medication for a mental, social, psychiatric, or psychological illness.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-107(3): A residential, vocational and life skills program may not admit a minor.


Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-108 Financial requirements.
-------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-108(1): 13-53-103(2) When applying for registration under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-108(1)(a): is financially sound; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-108(1)(b): reasonably has the fiscal ability to fulfill commitments and obligations to the participants of the residential, vocational and life skills program.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-108(2): (1); (2)(b) Evidence acceptable to satisfy the requirement described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-108(2)(a): (2)(b) for a residential, vocational and life skills program that has been in operation less than one fiscal year:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-108(2)(a)(i): (2)(b) pro forma financial statements until further information described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-108(2)(a)(ii): a commercial credit report for the residential, vocational and life skills program; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-108(2)(b): for a residential, vocational and life skills program that has completed a fiscal year, and as soon as the residential, vocational and life skills program completes its first fiscal year:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-108(2)(b)(i): a current financial statement, with all applicable footnotes, for the most recent fiscal year, including a balance sheet, a statement of income, a statement of retained earnings, and a statement of cash flow; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-108(2)(b)(ii): a certified fiscal audit of the residential, vocational and life skills program's financial statement, performed by a certified or licensed public accountant.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-108(3): (3)(a); (3)(a) In evaluating a residential, vocational and life skills program's fiscal responsibility, the division may consider:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-108(3)(a): any judgment, tax lien, collection action, bankruptcy schedule, or history of late payments to creditors;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-108(3)(b): (3)(a) documentation showing the resolution of a matter described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-108(3)(c): (3)(a) the residential, vocational and life skills program's explanation for a matter described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-108(3)(d): a guarantee agreement provided for the residential, vocational and life skills program; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-108(3)(e): history of a prior entity that:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-108(3)(e)(i): is owned or operated by any individual who is an officer, a director, or an administrator of the residential, vocational and life skills program; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-108(3)(e)(ii): has failed to maintain fiscal responsibility.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-108(4): The division may require evidence of financial status at other times when it is in the best interest of the program participants to require the information.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-108(5): The division may perform a fiscal audit of a residential, vocational and life skills program.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-108(6): A residential, vocational and life skills program shall develop and maintain adequate internal controls for receipt, management, and disbursement of money that are reasonable in light of the residential, vocational and life skills program's organizational complexity.


Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-109 Discontinuance of operations.
-------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-109(1): A residential, vocational and life skills program that is closing shall adopt a plan for the provision of food, shelter, and clothing for at least 30 days from the date of closure to participants displaced by the closure.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-109(2): (1) At least 30 days before the day on which the residential, vocational and life skills program will close, the residential, vocational and life skills program shall provide written notice to the division of:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-109(2)(a): the intended date of closure; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-109(2)(b): (1) the plan described in Subsection


Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-110 Enforcement.
--------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-110(1): Chapter 2, Division of Consumer Protection The division may investigate facilities and enforce this chapter under the authority described in
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-110(2): To monitor the welfare of participants and transitional graduates, if any, and to monitor the safe operation of a residential, vocational and life skills program, the division shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-110(2)(a): annually perform an on-site inspection of a registered residential, vocational and life skills program;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-110(2)(b): refer each concern that the division identifies during the on-site inspection to the state or municipal entity responsible for the area of concern; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-110(2)(c): coordinate with each relevant state and municipal entity to monitor the residential, vocational and life skills program's compliance with the entity's relevant health and safety regulations.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-110(3): Chapter 2, Division of Consumer Protection In addition to penalties established by this chapter and in addition to the enforcement authority described in
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-110(3)(a): issue a cease and desist order;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-110(3)(b): impose an administrative fine of up to $2,500 for each violation of this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-110(3)(c): seek injunctive relief in a court of competent jurisdiction.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-110(4): 13-2-8 All money received from fines imposed under this section shall be deposited into the Consumer Protection Education and Training Fund, created in Section


Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-111 Recidivism reporting requirements.
------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-111(1): On or before August 31 of each year, a residential, vocational and life skills program shall collect and report data on recidivism of participants to the State Commission on Criminal and Juvenile Justice.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-53-111(2): (1); 63M-7-102 The report described in Subsection

Utah Code Annotated - Title 13 - Chapter 54 - Ticket Website Sales Act
**********************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-101 Title.
--------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Ticket Website Sales Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-102 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-102(1): "Consumer" means a person who purchases a ticket for use by the person or the person's invitee.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-102(2): "Division" means the Division of Consumer Protection in the Department of Commerce.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-102(3): "Domain" means the portion of text in a URL that is to the left of the top-level domain.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-102(4): (4)(a); (d) "Event" means a single, specific occurrence of one of the following, that takes place at a venue:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-102(4)(a): a concert;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-102(4)(b): a game;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-102(4)(c): a performance;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-102(4)(d): a show; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-102(4)(e): (4)(a); (d) an occasion similar to the occasions described in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-102(5): (5)(a); (e) "Event participant" means any of the following persons who is associated with an event or on behalf of whom a person sells a ticket to an event:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-102(5)(a): an artist;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-102(5)(b): a league;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-102(5)(c): a team;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-102(5)(d): a tour group;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-102(5)(e): a venue; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-102(5)(f): (5)(a); (e) any person similar to the persons described in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-102(6): "Person" does not include a government entity.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-102(7): "Primary ticket seller" means the person who first sells a particular ticket.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-102(8): (8)(a)
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-102(8)(a): "Reseller" means a person who sells or offers for sale a ticket after it is sold by a primary ticket seller.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-102(8)(b): (8)(a) "Reseller" includes a person who engages in conduct described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-102(8)(c): "Reseller" does not include a person who transfers a ticket to another person without reimbursement or consideration.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-102(9): "Ticket" means evidence of an individual's right of entry to an event.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-102(10): "Ticket aggregator" means a person who aggregates the prices for which other persons offer tickets for sale or resale.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-102(11): "Ticket purchasing software" means software that is primarily designed for the purpose of:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-102(11)(a): interfering with the sale of tickets by circumventing controls or measures on a ticket website to bypass posted event ticket purchasing limits; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-102(11)(b): undermining the integrity of posted online ticket purchasing order rules.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-102(12): "Ticket website" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-102(12)(a): with respect to a reseller, a website on which the reseller sells or offers for sale or resale one or more tickets; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-102(12)(b): with respect to a ticket aggregator, a website on which the ticket aggregator aggregates the prices for which other persons offer tickets for sale or resale.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-102(13): "Top-level domain" includes .com, .net, and .org.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-102(14): "URL" means the uniform resource locator for a website on the Internet.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-102(15): 
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-102(15)(a): "Venue" means real property located in the state where one or more persons host a concert, game, performance, show, or similar occasion.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-102(15)(b): "Venue" includes an arena, a stadium, a theater, a concert hall, an amphitheater, a fairground, a club, a convention center, a public assembly facility, or a mass gathering location.


Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-103 Exemptions.
-------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-103(1): This chapter does not apply to:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-103(1)(a): an entity that is owned, controlled, operated, or maintained by a bona fide church or religious organization that is exempt from property taxation under the laws of the state; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-103(1)(b): a consumer reselling a ticket that the consumer purchased as a consumer.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-103(2): A person who claims an exemption under this section has the burden of proving that the person is entitled to the exemption.


Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-201 Disclosure requirements.
--------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-201(1): A reseller or ticket aggregator shall clearly and conspicuously disclose on each of its ticket websites that:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-201(1)(a): the website is a secondary market and is not the primary ticket seller; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-201(1)(b): the price of a ticket on the website may be higher than face value.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-201(2): A primary ticket seller and a reseller shall clearly and conspicuously disclose during the checkout process an itemization of the total price for which the primary ticket seller or reseller is offering the ticket for sale or resale, including taxes and each fee.


Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-202 Prohibited practices.
-----------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-202(1): (1)(a); (1)(b)(i); (ii)
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-202(1)(a): It is unlawful for any person who is not a primary ticket seller to represent, directly or indirectly, that the person is a primary ticket seller.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-202(1)(b): (1)(a); (1)(b)(i); (ii) If a presiding officer or court determines appropriate after considering other relevant factors, the following actions by a person who is not a primary ticket seller establish a presumption that the person is representing that the person is a primary ticket seller in violation of Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-202(1)(b)(i): using the name of an event in the domain of the person's ticket website, unless the person has written authorization from an agent of the event;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-202(1)(b)(ii): using the name of an event participant in the domain of the person's ticket website, unless the person has written authorization from the event participant or an agent of the event participant;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-202(1)(b)(iii): (1)(b)(i); (ii) using, in paid search results, the name of an event or event participant in a manner described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-202(1)(b)(iv): using on the person's website any of the following that individually or in combination is substantially similar to a primary ticket seller's, venue's, or event's website, with the intent to mislead a potential purchaser, without written authorization:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-202(1)(b)(iv)(A): text;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-202(1)(b)(iv)(B): images;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-202(1)(b)(iv)(C): website graphics;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-202(1)(b)(iv)(D): website design; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-202(1)(b)(iv)(E): Internet address.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-202(2): It is unlawful for a person who lists or offers a ticket for sale to:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-202(2)(a): accept payment for the ticket; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-202(2)(b): fail to deliver to the consumer who purchases the ticket a ticket that reflects the transaction to which the parties agreed.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-202(3): It is unlawful for a person to:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-202(3)(a): knowingly sell more than one copy of the same ticket;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-202(3)(b): use ticket purchasing software to circumvent any portion of the process for purchasing a ticket on a ticket website, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-202(3)(b)(i): circumventing:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-202(3)(b)(i)(A): security measures;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-202(3)(b)(i)(B): identity validation measures; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-202(3)(b)(i)(C): an access control system; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-202(3)(b)(ii): disguising the identity of a ticket purchaser for the purpose of purchasing a number of tickets that exceeds the maximum number of tickets allowed for a person to purchase.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-202(4): 13-54-201 It is unlawful for a person to fail to comply with a provision of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-202(5): Nothing in this section prohibits a person from including the name of an event or an event participant in a URL after the top-level domain.


Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-203 Resale refund requirements.
-----------------------------------------------------------
A primary ticket seller or reseller from which a consumer purchases a ticket shall guarantee a full refund, including handling fees, if:Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-203(1): the event for which the primary ticket seller or reseller sold the ticket is canceled;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-203(2): the ticket does not grant the purchaser admission to the event;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-203(3): the ticket is counterfeit; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-203(4): the ticket fails to conform to the description that the primary ticket seller or reseller advertised to the purchaser.


Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-301 Enforcement powers.
---------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-301(1): Chapter 2, Division of Consumer Protection The division may enforce the provisions of this chapter in accordance with
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-301(2): Chapter 2, Division of Consumer Protection
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-301(2)(a): Chapter 2, Division of Consumer Protection In addition to the division's enforcement powers under
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-301(2)(a)(i): the division director may impose an administrative fine of up to $2,500 for each violation of this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-301(2)(a)(ii): the division may bring an action in a court of competent jurisdiction to enforce the provisions of this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-301(2)(b): In a court action by the division to enforce a provision of this chapter, the court may:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-301(2)(b)(i): find that an act or practice violates a provision of this chapter; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-301(2)(b)(ii): award, for each violation of this chapter:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-301(2)(b)(ii)(A): actual damages on behalf of each consumer who complained to the division within a reasonable time after the division initiated the court action; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-301(2)(b)(ii)(B): a fine of up to $2,500.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-301(2)(c): For any judgment in favor of the division under this section, the court may award:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-301(2)(c)(i): costs, including the costs of investigation; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-301(2)(c)(ii): reasonable attorney fees.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-301(3): Each ticket sold or offered for sale while a person is in violation of a provision of this chapter constitutes a separate violation of this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-301(4): Nothing in this chapter affects:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-301(4)(a): a remedy available to a person independent of this chapter; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-54-301(4)(b): the division's ability or authority to enforce any other law.


Utah Code Annotated - Title 13 - Chapter 56 - Ticket Transferability Act
************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 13-56-101 Title.
--------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Ticket Transferability Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 13-56-102 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this section:Utah Code Annotated § 13-56-102(1): "Division" means the Division of Consumer Protection in the Department of Commerce.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-56-102(2): (2)(a); (d) "Event" means a single, specific occurrence of one of the following, that takes place at a venue:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-56-102(2)(a): a concert;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-56-102(2)(b): a game;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-56-102(2)(c): a performance;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-56-102(2)(d): a show; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-56-102(2)(e): (2)(a); (d) an occasion similar to the occasions described in Subsections
Utah Code Annotated § 13-56-102(3): "Exempt entity" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-56-102(3)(a): a Division I college postseason basketball tournament;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-56-102(3)(b): a nonprofit organization that:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-56-102(3)(b)(i): is exempt from federal income taxation under Section 501(c)(3), Internal Revenue Code;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-56-102(3)(b)(ii): is domiciled in the state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-56-102(3)(b)(iii): produces an annual international film festival in the state; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-56-102(3)(c): a public or private postsecondary institution that is located in the state.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-56-102(4): "Restricted ticket" means a ticket to an event that is subject to a restriction that prohibits the purchaser from reselling or otherwise transferring the ticket by any lawful method.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-56-102(5): "Transferrable ticket" means a ticket to an event that a person issues using a delivery method that enables the purchaser to lawfully resell the ticket independent of the person who issued the ticket or the person's agent or operator.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-56-102(6): 
Utah Code Annotated § 13-56-102(6)(a): "Venue" means real property located in the state where one or more persons host a concert, game, performance, show, or similar occasion.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-56-102(6)(b): "Venue" includes an arena, a stadium, a theater, a concert hall, an amphitheater, a fairground, a club, a convention center, a public assembly facility, or a mass gathering location.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-56-102(7): "Venue operator" means a person who operates a venue.


Utah Code Annotated § 13-56-103 Scope.
--------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-56-103(1): This chapter does not apply to an event or venue of an exempt entity.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-56-103(2): Nothing in this chapter prohibits a venue operator from maintaining and enforcing one or more policies regarding conduct or behavior at or in connection with the venue.

Utah Code Annotated - Title 13 - Chapter 57 - Maintenance Funding Practices Act
*******************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 13-57-101 Title.
--------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Maintenance Funding Practices Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 13-57-102 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 13-57-102(1): "Business entity" means a sole proprietorship, partnership, limited partnership, limited liability company, corporation, or other entity or association used to carry on a business for profit.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-57-102(2): "Director" means the director of the Division of Consumer Protection.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-57-102(3): 13-2-1 "Division" means the Division of Consumer Protection of the Department of Commerce established in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 13-57-102(4): 78B-3-403 "Health care provider" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 13-57-102(5): "Individual" means a person who:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-57-102(5)(a): resides in this state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-57-102(5)(b): has or may have a pending legal action in this state.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-57-102(6): "Legal funding" means a payment of $500,000 or less to an individual in exchange for the right to receive an amount out of the potential proceeds of any realized settlement, judgment, award, or verdict the individual may receive in a civil legal action.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-57-102(7): "Maintenance funding agreement" means an agreement between an individual and a maintenance funding provider under which the maintenance funding provider provides legal funding to the individual.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-57-102(8): 
Utah Code Annotated § 13-57-102(8)(a): "Maintenance funding provider" means a business entity that engages in the business of legal funding.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-57-102(8)(b): "Maintenance funding provider" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-57-102(8)(b)(i): an immediate family member of an individual;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-57-102(8)(b)(ii): an accountant providing accounting services to an individual; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-57-102(8)(b)(iii): an attorney providing legal services to an individual.

Utah Code Annotated § 13-57-202 Maintenance funding provider operations.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-57-202(1): 13-57-301 A maintenance funding provider may only provide legal funding to an individual if the maintenance funding provider and the individual enter into a maintenance funding agreement that meets the requirements of Section
Utah Code Annotated § 13-57-202(2): Before executing a maintenance funding agreement, a maintenance funding provider shall file with the division a template of the maintenance funding agreement.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-57-202(3): (3)(a)(i); (ii); (3)(a); (3)(a) A maintenance funding provider may not:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-57-202(3)(a): (3)(a)(i); (ii) pay or offer to pay a commission, referral fee, or any other form of consideration to the following for referring an individual to the maintenance funding provider:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-57-202(3)(a)(i): an attorney authorized to practice law;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-57-202(3)(a)(ii): a health care provider; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-57-202(3)(a)(iii): (3)(a)(i); (ii) an employee, independent contractor, or other person affiliated with a person described in Subsection

Utah Code Annotated § 13-57-202(3)(c): (3)(a) refer an individual or potential individual to a person described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 13-57-202(3)(d): intentionally advertise materially false or misleading information about the maintenance funding provider's services;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-57-202(3)(e): make or attempt to influence a decision relating to the conduct, settlement, or resolution of a legal action for which the maintenance funding provider provides legal funding; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-57-202(3)(f): knowingly pay or offer to pay court costs, filing fees, or attorney fees using legal funding.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-57-202(4): A maintenance funding provider shall provide an individual who enters a maintenance funding agreement a copy of the executed maintenance funding agreement.


Utah Code Annotated § 13-57-203 Annual reports.
-----------------------------------------------

Utah Code Annotated § 13-57-301 Maintenance funding agreements.
---------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-57-301(1): 13-57-302 A maintenance funding agreement shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-57-301(1)(a): be in writing;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-57-301(1)(b): contain a right of rescission permitting the individual to cancel the agreement without penalty or further obligation, if the individual returns to the maintenance funding provider the full amount of the disbursed funds:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-57-301(1)(b)(i): within five business days after the day on which the individual and maintenance funding provider enter the agreement; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-57-301(1)(b)(ii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 13-57-301(1)(b)(ii)(A): in person by delivering the maintenance funding provider's uncashed check to the maintenance funding provider's office; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-57-301(1)(b)(ii)(B): by insured, certified, or registered United States mail to the address specified in the maintenance funding agreement in the form of the maintenance funding provider's uncashed check or a registered or certified check or money order;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-57-301(1)(c): 13-57-302 contain the disclosures described in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 13-57-301(1)(d): include the amount of money the maintenance funding provider provides to the individual;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-57-301(1)(e): include an itemization of one-time charges;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-57-301(1)(f): include a payment schedule that:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-57-301(1)(f)(i): includes the funded amount and all charges; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-57-301(1)(f)(ii): lists the total amount of any realized settlement, judgment, award, or verdict to be paid to the maintenance funding provider at the end of each six-month period, if the contract is satisfied during that period; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-57-301(1)(g): include a provision that the maintenance funding agreement includes no charge or fee other than the charges and fees disclosed in the maintenance funding agreement; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-57-301(1)(h): include a provision that:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-57-301(1)(h)(i): if there are no available proceeds from the legal action, the individual will owe the maintenance funding provider nothing; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-57-301(1)(h)(ii): the maintenance funding provider's total charges will be paid only to the extent there are available proceeds from the legal action after the settlement of all liens, fees, and other costs.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-57-301(2): A maintenance funding agreement may not require an individual to make a payment to the maintenance funding provider in an amount determined as a percentage of the recovery from the legal action.


Utah Code Annotated § 13-57-302 Required disclosures.
-----------------------------------------------------
A maintenance funding provider shall disclose in a maintenance funding agreement:Utah Code Annotated § 13-57-302(1): that the maintenance funding provider may not participate in deciding whether, when, or the amount for which a legal action is settled;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-57-302(2): that the maintenance funding provider may not interfere with the independent professional judgment of the attorney handling the legal action or any settlement of the legal action;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-57-302(3): the following statement in substantially the following form, in all capital letters and at least a 12-point type: "THE FUNDED AMOUNT AND AGREED-TO CHARGES SHALL BE PAID ONLY FROM THE PROCEEDS OF YOUR LEGAL CLAIM, AND SHALL BE PAID ONLY TO THE EXTENT THAT THERE ARE AVAILABLE PROCEEDS FROM YOUR LEGAL CLAIM. YOU WILL NOT OWE (INSERT NAME OF THE MAINTENANCE FUNDING PROVIDER HERE) ANYTHING IF THERE ARE NO PROCEEDS FROM YOUR LEGAL CLAIM, UNLESS YOU HAVE VIOLATED A MATERIAL TERM OF THIS AGREEMENT OR YOU HAVE COMMITTED FRAUD AGAINST THE MAINTENANCE FUNDING PROVIDER.";
Utah Code Annotated § 13-57-302(4): 13-57-301 in accordance with Section
Utah Code Annotated § 13-57-302(5): immediately above the line for the individual's signature, the following statement in at least a 12-point type: "Do not sign this agreement before you read it completely or if it contains any blank spaces. You are entitled to a completed copy of the agreement. Before you sign this agreement, you should obtain the advice of an attorney. Depending on your circumstances, you may want to consult a tax, benefits planning, or financial professional."

Utah Code Annotated § 13-57-501 Enforceability.
-----------------------------------------------
If a maintenance funding provider violates a provision of this chapter, a maintenance funding agreement associated with the violation is unenforceable by the maintenance funding provider or any successor-in-interest to the maintenance funding agreement.

---------------------------------------------------------

Utah Code Annotated § 13-57-502(1)(a): revoking or suspending a maintenance funding provider's registration;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-57-502(1)(b): ordering a maintenance funding provider to cease and desist from further legal funding;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-57-502(1)(c): imposing a penalty of up to:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-57-502(1)(c)(i): $1,000 per violation; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-57-502(1)(c)(ii): $10,000 per violation that the division finds willful; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-57-502(1)(d): ordering the maintenance funding provider to make restitution to an individual.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-57-502(2): 13-2-6 The division's enforcement powers under this section and Section

Utah Code Annotated - Title 13 - Chapter 58 - Motorboat Agreements Act
**********************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 13-58-101 Title.
--------------------------------------
This chapter is known as the "Motorboat Agreements Act."

Utah Code Annotated § 13-58-102 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 13-58-102(1): "Agreement" means an agreement between:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-58-102(1)(a): a motorboat dealer; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-58-102(1)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 13-58-102(1)(b)(i): a manufacturer; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-58-102(1)(b)(ii): a distributor.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-58-102(2): "Distributor" means a person who:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-58-102(2)(a): has an agreement with a manufacturer of motorboats to distribute motorboats within this state; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-58-102(2)(b): in whole or in part sells or distributes motorboats to motorboat dealers.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-58-102(3): "Manufacturer" means a person engaged in the business of constructing, manufacturing, assembling, producing, or importing new motorboats for the purpose of sale or trade.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-58-102(4): 73-18-2 "Motorboat" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 13-58-102(5): "Motorboat dealer" means a person who:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-58-102(5)(a): is engaged in the business of buying, selling, offering for sale, or exchanging new motorboats either outright or on conditional sale, bailment, lease, chattel mortgage, or otherwise; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-58-102(5)(b): has established in this state a place of business for the sale, lease, trade, or display of new motorboats.


Utah Code Annotated § 13-58-201 Agreement requirement -- Terms of agreements.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-58-201(1): A person may not act as a motorboat dealer in this state without entering into an agreement.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-58-201(2): An agreement shall include:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-58-201(2)(a): each working capital standard, inventory standard, facility standard, equipment standard, and tool standard, if any, including each agreed upon minimum product stocking requirement;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-58-201(2)(b): provisions for termination or nonrenewal of the agreement;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-58-201(2)(c): the designation of a successor motorboat dealer in the event of the motorboat dealer's death or disability;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-58-201(2)(d): the obligations of the manufacturer, distributor, and motorboat dealer in the preparation and delivery of, and warranty service on, new motorboats and new motorboat motors;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-58-201(2)(e): the obligations of the manufacturer, distributor, and new motorboat dealer upon termination of the agreement, including obligations in relation to:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-58-201(2)(e)(i): inventory of new motorboats;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-58-201(2)(e)(ii): inventory of new motorboat motors;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-58-201(2)(e)(iii): inventory of parts;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-58-201(2)(e)(iv): equipment;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-58-201(2)(e)(v): furnishings;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-58-201(2)(e)(vi): special tools; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-58-201(2)(e)(vii): required signs;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-58-201(2)(f): each standard for maintenance of:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-58-201(2)(f)(i): a dedicated or self-funded line of credit, if any; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-58-201(2)(f)(ii): a trade-in line of credit or self-funded trade-in line of credit, if any; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-58-201(2)(g): dispute resolution procedures.


Utah Code Annotated § 13-58-301 Motorboat dealer default.
---------------------------------------------------------
A motorboat dealer defaults on an agreement if the motorboat dealer:Utah Code Annotated § 13-58-301(1): materially fails to:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-58-301(1)(a): meet minimum product stocking requirements as specified under the agreement;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-58-301(1)(b): make timely payment of a material obligation as specified under the agreement; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-58-301(1)(c): meet an applicable standard, as specified by the agreement, for:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-58-301(1)(c)(i): a dedicated or self-funded line of credit; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-58-301(1)(c)(ii): a trade-in or self-funded trade-in line of credit; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-58-301(2): markets the manufacturer's motorboats outside of the motorboat dealer's territory in violation of the agreement.

Utah Code Annotated § 13-58-401(2)(f)(ii): that the manufacturer required the dealer to acquire; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-58-401(2)(f)(iii): that are in good and usable condition; and

Utah Code Annotated § 13-58-402 Termination without time to cure.
-----------------------------------------------------------------
A manufacturer or distributor may terminate an agreement with a motorboat dealer upon written notice and without a cure period described in SectionUtah Code Annotated § 13-58-402(1): 13-58-302 the motorboat dealer:

Utah Code Annotated § 13-58-402(1)(b): becomes subject to an order for relief, as defined in 11 U.S.C. Sec. 102;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-58-402(1)(c): files a voluntary petition in bankruptcy;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-58-402(1)(d): has had an involuntary petition in bankruptcy filed against the motorboat dealer;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-58-402(1)(e): engages in an act of material fraud in relation to the performance of a right or obligation under the agreement;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-58-402(1)(f): is a corporation that ceases to exist;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-58-402(1)(g): becomes insolvent;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-58-402(1)(h): takes or fails to take an action that constitutes an admission of inability to pay debts as the debts mature;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-58-402(1)(i): makes a general assignment for the benefit of creditors to an agent authorized to liquidate any substantial amount of assets;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-58-402(1)(j): applies to a court for the appointment of a receiver for any assets or properties;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-58-402(1)(k): fails to substantially comply with a federal, state, or local law, rule, regulation, ordinance, or order applicable to the agreement;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-58-402(1)(l): 13-58-302 receives three valid notices of a default under Section
Utah Code Annotated § 13-58-402(1)(m): transfers an interest in the dealership without the manufacturer's written consent;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-58-402(1)(n): has pleaded guilty to or has been convicted of a felony, or of any misdemeanor relating to the relationship between the motorboat dealer and manufacturer;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-58-402(1)(o): or one of the owners of the motorboat dealer is convicted or enters a plea of nolo contendere to a felony; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-58-402(1)(p): makes a material misrepresentation;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-58-402(2): there is a closeout or sale of a substantial part of the dealer's assets related to the motorboat dealership;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-58-402(3): there is a commencement or dissolution or liquidation of the motorboat dealership;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-58-402(4): there is a change without the prior written approval of the manufacturer in the location of the motorboat dealer's principal place of business under the dealership agreement; or
