Utah Code Annotated § 13-72-305(2): A participant may request a single 12-month extension for participation in the learning laboratory period no later than 30 days before the end of the initial 12-month period.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-72-305(3): The office shall grant or deny an extension request before expiration of the initial demonstration period.


Utah Code Annotated - Title 13 - Chapter 73 - Motor Vehicle Consumer Data Protection
************************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
As used in this chapter:Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(1): "Authorized integrator" means a third party with whom a franchisee enters into a contract to perform a specific function for a franchisee that allows the third party to access protected dealer data or to write data to a dealer data system, or both, to carry out the specified function.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(2): "Consumer data" means non-public personal information defined in 15 U.S.C. Sec. 6809(4) as it existed on January 1, 2024.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(3): "Cyber ransom" means to encrypt, restrict, or prohibit, or to threaten or attempt to encrypt, restrict, or prohibit a franchisee's or a franchisee's authorized integrator's access to protected dealer data or other dealer data to obtain payment not agreed to by the franchisee or the franchisee's authorized integrator in a written contract for services or goods.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(4)(a): "Dealer data system" means a software, hardware, or firmware system that is owned, leased, or licensed by a franchisee, that includes a system of web-based applications, computer software, or computer hardware, whether located at the franchisee's dealership or hosted remotely, and that stores or provides access to protected dealer data.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(4)(b): "Dealer data system" means a dealership management system or a consumer relationship management system.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(5): "Dealer data vendor" means a third party dealer management system provider, consumer relationship management system provider, or third party vendor providing similar services that store protected dealer data pursuant to a contract with the franchisee.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(6): 13-14-102 "Dealership" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(7): "Fee" means payment for access to protected dealer data which is in addition to charges written in an executed contract for goods or services.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(8): 13-14-102 "Franchisee" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(9): "Franchisee program" means a bonus, incentive, rebate, or other payment program that a franchisor offers to a franchisee.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(10): 13-14-102 "Franchisor" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(11): 
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(11)(a): "Manufacturer" means a manufacturer of new motor vehicles.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(11)(b): "Manufacturer" does not include a manufacturer acting in the capacity of a vendor, service provider, dealer data vendor, or an affiliate or subsidiary of a manufacturer operating as a vendor, service provider, or a dealer data vendor.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(11)(c): "Manufacturer" does not include a manufacturer that does not have a franchisee in the state.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(12): "Other generally accepted standards" means security standards that are at least as comprehensive as STAR standards.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(13): "Prior express written consent" means a franchisee's express written consent to protected dealer data sharing that:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(13)(a): is in a document separate from any other:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(13)(a)(i): consent;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(13)(a)(ii): contract;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(13)(a)(iii): franchise agreement; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(13)(a)(iv): writing;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(13)(b): identifies all parties with whom the protected dealer data may be shared; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(13)(c): contains:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(13)(c)(i): all details that the franchisee requires relating to the scope and nature of the protected dealer data to be shared, including the data fields and the duration for which the sharing is authorized; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(13)(c)(ii): all provisions and restrictions that are required under federal law to allow sharing the protected dealer data.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(14): 
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(14)(a): "Protected dealer data" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(14)(a)(i): consumer data that:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(14)(a)(i)(A): 
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(14)(a)(i)(A)(I): a consumer provides to a franchisee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(14)(a)(i)(A)(II): a franchisee otherwise obtains; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(14)(a)(i)(B): is stored in the franchisee's dealer data system;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(14)(a)(ii): other data that relates to a franchisee's daily business operations and is stored in the franchisee's dealer data system; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(14)(a)(iii): motor vehicle diagnostic data.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(14)(b): "Protected dealer data" does not include data that:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(14)(b)(i): is otherwise publicly available; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(14)(b)(ii): a franchisor or third party obtains through another source.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(15): 
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(15)(a): "Required manufacturer data" means data that:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(15)(a)(i): a manufacturer is required to obtain under federal or state law;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(15)(a)(ii): is required to complete or verify a transaction between the franchisee and the manufacturer;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(15)(a)(iii): is motor vehicle diagnostic data; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(15)(a)(iv): is reasonably necessary for:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(15)(a)(iv)(A): a safety notice, recall notice, manufacturer field action, or other legal notice obligation relating to the repair, service, and update of a motor vehicle;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(15)(a)(iv)(B): the sale and delivery of a new motor vehicle or certified used motor vehicle to a consumer, including necessary data for the vehicle manufacturer to activate services purchased by the consumer;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(15)(a)(iv)(C): the validation and payment of consumer or franchisee incentives;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(15)(a)(iv)(D): claims for franchisee-supplied services relating to warranty parts or repairs;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(15)(a)(iv)(E): the evaluation of franchisee performance, including the evaluation of the franchisee's monthly financial statements and sales or service, consumer satisfaction with the franchisee through direct consumer contact, or consumer surveys;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(15)(a)(iv)(F): franchisee and market analytics;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(15)(a)(iv)(G): the identification of the franchisee that sold or leased a specific motor vehicle and the date of the transaction;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(15)(a)(iv)(H): marketing purposes designed for the benefit of franchisees, or to direct leads to the franchisee providing the dealer protected data to the franchisor;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(15)(a)(iv)(I): the development, evaluation, or improvement of the manufacturer's products or services; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(15)(a)(iv)(J): the daily operational interactions of the franchisee with the manufacturer or other franchisees through applications hosted on the manufacturer's dealer electronic communications system.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(15)(b): "Required manufacturer data" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(15)(b)(i): consumer data on the consumer's credit application; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(15)(b)(ii): a franchisee's individualized notes about a consumer that are not related to a transaction.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(16): "Service provider" means a person that processes protected dealer data on behalf of a franchisee and that receives, from or on behalf of the franchisee, consumer protected dealer data for a business purpose pursuant to a written contract, if the contract prohibits the person from:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(16)(a): selling or sharing the protected dealer data;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(16)(b): retaining, using, or disclosing the protected dealer data for any purpose other than for the business purposes specified in the contract for the franchisee, including retaining, using, or disclosing the protected dealer data for a commercial purpose other than the business purposes specified in the contract with the franchisee, or as permitted under this title;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(16)(c): retaining, using, or disclosing the protected dealer data outside of the direct business relationship between the service provider and the franchisee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(16)(d): combining the protected dealer data that the service provider receives from, or on behalf of, the franchisee with personal information that the service provider receives from, or on behalf of, another person or persons, or collects from the service provider's own interaction with the consumer.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(17): "STAR standards" means the current, applicable security standards published by the Standards for Technology in Automotive Retail.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(18): 
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(18)(a): "Third party" means a person other than a franchisee.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(18)(b): "Third party" includes:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(18)(b)(i): a service provider;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(18)(b)(ii): a vendor, including a dealer data vendor and authorized integrator;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(18)(b)(iii): a manufacturer acting in the capacity of a vendor, service provider, or dealer data vendor; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(18)(b)(iv): an affiliate of a manufacturer described in Subsection (18)(b)(iii).
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(18)(c): "Third party" does not include:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(18)(c)(i): a governmental entity acting pursuant to federal, state, or local law;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(18)(c)(ii): a person acting pursuant to a valid court order;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(18)(c)(iii): a manufacturer, not acting in the capacity of a vendor, service provider, or dealer data vendor; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(18)(c)(iv): an affiliate of a manufacturer described in Subsection (18)(c)(iii).
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(19): "Vendor" means a person to whom a franchisee makes available protected dealer data for a business purpose, pursuant to a written contract with the franchisee, if the contract:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(19)(a): prohibits the vendor from:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(19)(a)(i): selling or sharing the protected dealer data;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(19)(a)(ii): retaining, using, or disclosing the protected dealer data for any purpose other than for the business purposes specified in the contract, including retaining, using, or disclosing the protected dealer data for a commercial purpose other than the business purposes specified in the contract, or as otherwise permitted under this title;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(19)(a)(iii): retaining, using, or disclosing the protected dealer data outside of the direct business relationship between the vendor and the franchisee; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(19)(a)(iv): combining the protected dealer data that the vendor receives pursuant to a written contract with the franchisee with personal information that the vendor receives from or on behalf of another person or persons, or collects from the vendor's own interaction with the consumer;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(19)(b): includes a certification made by the vendor that the vendor understands the restrictions in Subsection (19)(a)(i) and will comply with the restrictions; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(19)(c): permits, subject to agreement with the vendor, the franchisee to monitor the vendor's compliance with the contract through measures, including ongoing manual reviews, automated scans, regular assessments, audits, or other technical and operational testing at least once every 12 months.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(20): "Unreasonable restriction" means:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(20)(a): an unreasonable limitation or condition on the scope or nature of the data that is shared with an authorized integrator;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(20)(b): an unreasonable limitation or condition on the ability of an authorized integrator to write data to a dealer data system;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(20)(c): an unreasonable limitation or condition on a third party that accesses or shares protected dealer data or that writes data to a dealer data system;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(20)(d): requiring unreasonable access to a franchisor's or a third party's sensitive, competitive, or other confidential business information as a condition for accessing protected dealer data or sharing protected dealer data with an authorized integrator;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(20)(e): prohibiting or limiting a franchisee's ability to store, copy, securely share, or use protected dealer data outside of the dealer data system in any manner or for any reason; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-101(20)(f): allowing access to, or accessing protected dealer data without, the franchisee's prior express written consent.


Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-102 Applicability.
----------------------------------------------
This chapter does not:Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-102(1): govern, restrict, or apply to data outside of a dealer data system, including data that is generated by a motor vehicle or a device that a consumer connects to a motor vehicle;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-102(2): authorize a franchisee or third party to use data that the franchisee or third party obtains from a person in a manner that is inconsistent with:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-102(2)(a): an agreement with the person; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-102(2)(b): the purposes for which the person provides the data to the franchisee or third party; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-102(3): except as is necessary to fulfill a franchisee's obligation to provide warranty, repair, or service to consumers, grant a franchisee:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-102(3)(a): ownership of motor vehicle diagnostic data; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-102(3)(b): rights to share or use motor vehicle diagnostic data.


Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-201 Data submissions to franchisors or third parties.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-201(1): A franchisor or third party may not require a franchisee to grant to the franchisor, third party, or person acting on behalf of the franchisor or third party, direct or indirect access to the franchisee's dealer data system.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-201(2): A franchisee may submit or push data or information to a franchisor or third party through an electronic file format or protocol if the electronic file format or protocol:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-201(2)(a): is widely accepted; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-201(2)(b): complies with:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-201(2)(b)(i): STAR standards; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-201(2)(b)(ii): other generally accepted standards.


Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-202 Service provider contracts -- Franchisors and third parties -- Prohibitions -- Requirements.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-202(1): 13-73-101
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-202(1)(a): A service provider contract may permit the franchisee to monitor the service provider's compliance with the contract through ongoing manual reviews, automated scans, regular assessments, audits, or other technical and operational testing, at least once every 12 months.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-202(1)(b): 13-73-101 If a service provider or vendor engages another person to assist the service provider or vendor in processing protected dealer data for a business purpose on behalf of the franchisee, or if another person engaged by the service provider or vendor engages a person to assist in processing protected dealer data for that business purpose, the service provider or vendor shall notify the franchisee of that engagement, and the engagement shall be pursuant to a written contract binding the person to observe all the requirements described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-202(2): 13-73-201 A franchisor or third party may not:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-202(2)(a): access, share, sell, copy, use, or transmit protected dealer data without prior express written consent;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-202(2)(b): engage in any act of cyber ransom; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-202(2)(c): 13-73-201 take action to prohibit or limit a franchisee's ability to protect, store, copy, share, or use protected dealer data, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-202(2)(c)(i): 13-73-201 imposing a fee for, or other restriction on, the franchisee or authorized integrator:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-202(2)(c)(i)(A): accessing or sharing protected dealer data;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-202(2)(c)(i)(B): writing data to a dealer data system; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-202(2)(c)(i)(C): 13-73-201 submitting or pushing data or information to the third party under Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-202(2)(c)(ii): unreasonably prohibiting a third party or an authorized integrator that satisfies STAR standards or other generally accepted standards from integrating into the franchisee's dealer data system; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-202(2)(c)(iii): placing an unreasonable restriction on integration by an authorized integrator or third party.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-202(3): 
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-202(3)(a): Notwithstanding Subsection (2)(c)(i)(A), a franchisor or a third party may charge a franchisee the franchisor's or third party's actual third party costs, including a reasonable profit margin for providing access to protected dealer data to a franchisee, authorized integrator, or other third party if the franchisor or third party:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-202(3)(a)(i): discloses the charge to the franchisee in writing; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-202(3)(a)(ii): upon written request by the franchisee, provides to the franchisee documentation that the charges were agreed to in writing by the franchisee or provided for in the contract for services or goods.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-202(3)(b): If a third party fails to comply with Subsection (3)(a), a charge described in Subsection (3)(a) is a fee prohibited under Subsection (2)(c)(i).
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-202(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-202(4)(a): A franchisee may unilaterally revoke or amend the prior express written consent described in Subsection (2)(a):
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-202(4)(a)(i): with 60 days notice without cause; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-202(4)(a)(ii): immediately for cause.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-202(4)(b): 
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-202(4)(b)(i): Except as provided in Subsection (4)(b)(ii), a franchisor may not seek or require prior express written consent as a condition of or factor for consideration or eligibility for a:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-202(4)(b)(i)(A): franchisor program;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-202(4)(b)(i)(B): standard or policy; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-202(4)(b)(i)(C): benefit to a franchisee.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-202(4)(b)(ii): If a franchisor's program reasonably requires delivery of information that is protected dealer data to qualify for the program and receive franchisor program benefits, a franchisee shall provide the information to participate in the franchisor program.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-202(5): This section does not:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-202(5)(a): limit a franchisee's, franchisor's, or third party's obligations:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-202(5)(a)(i): as a service provider;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-202(5)(a)(ii): under federal, state, or local law, to protect and secure protected dealer data; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-202(5)(a)(iii): regarding required manufacturer data; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-202(5)(b): require a franchisor to pay a benefit to a franchisee if the franchisee refuses to provide data reasonably necessary to participate in the franchisor program.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-202(6): A franchisor or franchisor's selected third party may not require a franchisee to pay a fee for sharing required manufacturer data if:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-202(6)(a): the franchisor requires a franchisee to provide required manufacturer data through a specific third party that the franchisor selects;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-202(6)(b): the franchisor does not allow the franchisee to submit the required manufacturer data using the franchisee's choice of a third party vendor;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-202(6)(c): the franchisee's data is in a format that is compatible with the format required by the franchisor; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-202(6)(d): the third party vendor satisfies the STAR standards or other generally accepted standards.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-202(7): A franchisor may not access, sell, copy, use, transmit, or require a franchisee to share or provide access to protected dealer data, unless:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-202(7)(a): the protected dealer data is required manufacturer data; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-202(7)(b): the franchisee provides prior express written consent.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-202(8): 13-73-101 A franchisor may only use required manufacturer data that the franchisor obtains from a dealer data system for the purposes described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-202(9): 
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-202(9)(a): A franchisor, authorized integrator, or other third party shall indemnify a franchisee for any claims or damages if:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-202(9)(a)(i): the claims or damages directly result from a violation of this section by the party from whom the franchisee is seeking indemnification;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-202(9)(a)(ii): the claims or damages directly result from a violation of this section by:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-202(9)(a)(ii)(A): a vendor or contractor as an agent acting on behalf of the party from whom the franchisee is seeking indemnification; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-202(9)(a)(ii)(B): a vendor or other service provider who the party from whom the franchisee is seeking indemnification required the franchisee to use; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-202(9)(a)(iii): the claims or damages result from a violation of this section for:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-202(9)(a)(iii)(A): accessing or providing access to protected dealer data;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-202(9)(a)(iii)(B): using protected dealer data; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-202(9)(a)(iii)(C): disclosing protected dealer data.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-202(9)(b): A franchisee bringing a cause of action against a franchisor, authorized integrator, or other third party for a violation of this section has the burden of proof.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-202(10): 13-73-101 Notwithstanding Subsection (6), this chapter does not restrict or limit a franchisor's right to:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-202(10)(a): access or obtain required manufacturer data;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-202(10)(b): 13-73-101 use, share, copy, or transmit required manufacturer data for the purposes described in Subsection
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-202(10)(c): use or control data that is:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-202(10)(c)(i): proprietary to the franchisor;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-202(10)(c)(ii): created by the franchisor;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-202(10)(c)(iii): obtained from a source other than the franchisee; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-202(10)(c)(iv): public information.


Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-203 Dealer data vendors -- Authorized integrators -- Requirements.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-203(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-203(1)(a): A dealer data vendor shall adopt and make available to a franchisee and authorized integrator in a standardized framework:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-203(1)(a)(i): the exchange, integration, and sharing of data between a dealer data system and an authorized integrator; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-203(1)(a)(ii): the retrieval of data by an authorized integrator.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-203(1)(b): The standardized framework described in Subsection (1)(a) shall comply with STAR standards or other generally accepted standards.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-203(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-203(2)(a): Except as provided in Subsection (2)(b), a dealer data vendor shall provide to an authorized integrator access to open application programming interfaces for the standardized framework described in Subsection (1) that meet the reasonable commercial or technical standard for secure data integration.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-203(2)(b): If the open application interfaces described in Subsection (2)(a) do not meet the reasonable commercial or technical standard for secure data integration, a dealer data vendor may provide to an authorized integrator a similar open access integration method that:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-203(2)(b)(i): provides the same or better access to an authorized integrator as an application programming interface; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-203(2)(b)(ii): uses the standardized framework described in Subsection (1).
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-203(3): A dealer data vendor and an authorized integrator:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-203(3)(a): may access, use, store, or share protected dealer data or any other data from a dealer data system only to the extent allowed in the written agreement with the franchisee;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-203(3)(b): shall, upon a franchisee's request, provide the franchisee with a list of all persons:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-203(3)(b)(i): with whom the dealer data vendor or authorized integrator is sharing, or has shared, protected dealer data; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-203(3)(b)(ii): to whom the dealer data vendor or authorized integrator has allowed or is allowing access to protected dealer data; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-203(3)(c): shall allow a franchisee to audit the dealer data vendor's or authorized integrator's access to and use of protected dealer data.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-203(4): A franchisee may terminate an agreement between a dealer data vendor or authorized integrator and the franchisee relating to access to, sharing of, selling of, copying, using, or transmitting protected dealer data upon 90 days' notice.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-203(5): 
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-203(5)(a): If a dealer data vendor or authorized integrator receives a franchisee's notice described in Subsection (4), the dealer data vendor or authorized integrator shall ensure a secure transition of all protected dealer data to a successor dealer data vendor or successor authorized integrator.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-203(5)(b): In fulfilling the dealer data vendor's or authorized integrator's duties under Subsection (5)(a), a dealer data vendor or authorized integrator shall:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-203(5)(b)(i): provide access to or an electronic copy of all protected dealer data and all other data stored in the dealer data system in:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-203(5)(b)(i)(A): a commercially reasonable time; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-203(5)(b)(i)(B): a format that the successor dealer data vendor or successor authorized integrator can access and use; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-73-203(5)(b)(ii): before the agreement terminates, delete or return to the franchisee all protected dealer data pursuant to the franchisee's written directions.


Utah Code Annotated - Title 13 - Chapter 74 - Firearm Financial Transactions
****************************************************************************

Utah Code Annotated § 13-74-101 Definitions.
--------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-74-101(1): "Ammunition" means ammunition or cartridge cases, primers, bullets, or propellant powder designed for use in a firearm.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-74-101(2): "Customer" means an individual who presents a payment card to a merchant for the purchase of a good or service.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-74-101(3): "Financial entity" means any person involved in facilitating or processing a payment card transaction, including:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-74-101(3)(a): a payment card network;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-74-101(3)(b): a merchant acquirer; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-74-101(3)(c): a payment facilitator.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-74-101(4): 76-10-501 "Firearm" means the same as that term is defined in Section
Utah Code Annotated § 13-74-101(5): 
Utah Code Annotated § 13-74-101(5)(a): "Firearm accessory or component" means a device specifically adapted to:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-74-101(5)(a)(i): enable the wearing or carrying about one's person or the storage or mounting in or on any conveyance of a firearm; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-74-101(5)(a)(ii): be inserted into or affixed to a firearm to enable, alter, or improve the functioning or capabilities of the firearm.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-74-101(5)(b): "Firearm accessory or component" includes a telescopic or laser sight, magazine, flash or sound suppressor, folding or aftermarket stock or grip, speedloader, brace, ammunition carrier, or light for target illumination.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-74-101(6): "Firearms code" means the merchant category code 5723, approved in September 2022 by the International Organization for Standardization, for firearms retailers.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-74-101(7): "Firearms retailer" means a merchant engaged in the lawful business of selling or trading firearms, firearm accessories or components, or ammunition.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-74-101(8): "Merchant" means a person physically located in the state who accepts a payment card from a customer for the purchase of a good or service.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-74-101(9): "Payment card" means a card, code, or other means by which a person may debit a deposit account or use a line of credit to purchase a good or service.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-74-101(10): "Reloading supplies" means any equipment, component, or material designed for the reloading of ammunition, including reloading presses, shell holders, powder measures, priming tools, reloading manuals, casings, and gunpowder.


Utah Code Annotated § 13-74-201 Limitations on firearms merchant codes.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-74-201(1): For the processing of a payment card transaction, a financial entity may not assign to a firearms retailer or require a firearms retailer to use the firearms code.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-74-201(2): For purposes of the sale of a firearm, a firearm accessory or component, ammunition, or reloading supplies, a firearms retailer may not provide the firearms code to a financial entity.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-74-201(3): A financial entity may not otherwise classify a firearms retailer separately from general merchandise retailers or sporting goods retailers.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-74-201(4): Nothing in this chapter:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-74-201(4)(a): limits a financial entity's ability to:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-74-201(4)(a)(i): negotiate with responsible parties; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-74-201(4)(a)(ii): comply with state or federal laws or regulations; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-74-201(4)(b): impairs a financial entity's activities related to dispute processing, fraud or compliance management, or protecting transaction integrity from concerns related to illegal or suspicious activities, data breaches, or cyber risks.


Utah Code Annotated § 13-74-301 Enforcement powers of the attorney general.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
Utah Code Annotated § 13-74-301(1): 
Utah Code Annotated § 13-74-301(1)(a): The attorney general has the sole authority to enforce the provisions of this chapter.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-74-301(1)(b): Nothing in this chapter creates a private right of action.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-74-301(2): 
Utah Code Annotated § 13-74-301(2)(a): If a person believes that a financial entity violated or is in violation of this chapter, the person may file a complaint with the attorney general.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-74-301(2)(b): Upon receipt of a complaint, the attorney general shall initiate an investigation.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-74-301(3): If, based on investigation, the attorney general believes that a financial entity violated or is in violation of this chapter, the attorney general shall send the financial entity written notice that identifies each violation and directs the financial entity to cease each violation within 30 days after the day on which the financial entity receives the notice.
Utah Code Annotated § 13-74-301(4): 
Utah Code Annotated § 13-74-301(4)(a): The attorney general shall initiate a civil action against a financial entity that fails to cease a violation of this chapter within the 30-day time period described in Subsection (3).
Utah Code Annotated § 13-74-301(4)(b): In an action under this subsection, the attorney general may seek, and the court may order:
Utah Code Annotated § 13-74-301(4)(b)(i): injunctive relief;
Utah Code Annotated § 13-74-301(4)(b)(ii): 
Utah Code Annotated § 13-74-301(4)(b)(ii)(A): if the court determines that the financial entity recklessly violated a provision of this chapter, a civil fine of $10,000 for each violation or actual damages, whichever is greater; or
Utah Code Annotated § 13-74-301(4)(b)(ii)(B): if the court determines that the financial entity willfully violated a provision of this chapter, a civil fine of $25,000 for each violation or actual damages, whichever is greater; and
Utah Code Annotated § 13-74-301(4)(b)(iii): costs and reasonable attorney fees to the attorney general if the court issues an injunction or imposes a civil fine.
